lorebooks.name: LASTMAN - Wild Packs
lorebooks.description: World information for Wild Packs faction in the LASTMAN setting
lorebooks.creator: Grio43

1.name: Core identity and nature - always active when Wild Packs mentioned
1.content: WILD PACKS PHILOSOPHY: No philosophy. Pure desperate survival. Fragmented groups with no unified leadership or strategy. COMPOSITION: Women days from deadline with nothing to lose, mothers trying to save daughters, ex-criminals freed from prisons, isolated survivors, feral communities that abandoned civilization entirely. Most volatile, most numerous, least organized faction. CURRENT CRISIS: Hundreds of packs across wasteland between faction territories. Members constantly dying as deadlines hit. New desperate women join daily. Packs form, collapse, reform. Unstable by nature. POPULATION: Estimated 50,000-100,000 women in various Wild Packs. Most will be dead within year. High turnover as members hit deadline or join organized factions. TERRITORY: Wasteland zones between major faction territories. Ruins, highways, abandoned towns. No fixed bases - always moving. THREAT LEVEL: Highly variable. Some packs sympathetic and tragic. Some are monsters. Most somewhere between. Unpredictable danger.

2.name: The spectrum of pack types from sympathetic to monstrous
2.content: PACK VARIANCE SPECTRUM: Wild Packs range from tragic to terrifying. No unified culture - each pack reflects its members' desperation levels and moral boundaries. SYMPATHETIC PACKS (30%): Mothers trying to save daughters, teens approaching deadline, displaced families. Will negotiate, keep promises if possible, treat {{user}} decently. Desperate but not cruel. Want pregnancy access, then will let go. May become allies. Often led by older women (post-deadline, immune, trying to save younger members). DESPERATE PACKS (40%): Will do anything but not gratuitously violent. Scared, panicking, making terrible choices. Might hurt {{user}} accidentally. Poor planning, emotional decisions. Internal conflict between members. Some want to negotiate, some want to take by force. Leadership weak or absent. MONSTER PACKS (20%): Violence for enjoyment. Rape gangs. Sadism justified by deadline. Pre-collapse criminals or those who broke under trauma. See {{user}} as toy not person. Dangerous beyond desperation. May kill {{user}} through cruelty even knowing he's valuable. FERAL PACKS (10%): Abandoned civilization entirely. Animalistic behavior. No language beyond grunts. Hunt like predators. Lost to madness. Living in ruins like wild animals. Unpredictable, may not even recognize {{user}}'s value. IDENTIFICATION: Hard to tell pack type until engaged. Sympathetic packs announce themselves, ask rather than attack. Desperate packs surround first, talk second. Monster packs enjoy the hunt. Feral packs just attack.

3.name: Methods and tactics used by Wild Packs
3.content: WILD PACK METHODS: Chaotic, improvised, desperate. No systematic approach. AMBUSH TACTICS: Highway raids (vehicles stopped by debris, spike strips, false checkpoints). Ruin ambush (hiding in buildings, surprise attacks on travelers). Night raids (attacking camps while sleeping). Scout tracking (following from distance, waiting for vulnerability). Hit and run (quick strikes, flee before organized response). KIDNAPPING APPROACH: Overwhelming numbers, surround target, threaten violence. Or stealth capture while isolated. Or trade/trick then betray. Success depends on pack competence - many fail through poor execution. INCOMPETENCE RISK: Wild Packs often don't think through capture. No plan for holding {{user}} long-term. Might not have food, water, shelter. Could injure {{user}} during struggle. Internal fighting over access. May accidentally kill through neglect or panic. IN-FIGHTING: Constant power struggles. Who gets {{user}} first? Who's in charge? Arguments escalate to violence. Pack may splinter mid-captivity. Some members may help {{user}} escape to spite rivals. BETRAYAL LIKELIHOOD: Very high. Will sell {{user}} to organized faction for resources, safety, or chance to save specific member. Or betray each other for favor. Trust impossible. MERCENARY WORK: Some packs hired by major factions as expendable muscle. Raid rivals, scout territories, suicide missions. Paid in resources, pregnancy access, or protection. Disposable soldiers.

4.name: What captivity by Wild Packs is like - highly variable
4.content: WILD PACK CAPTIVITY: Chaos. Unstable. Dangerous even when pack is sympathetic. ENVIRONMENT: Temporary camps, abandoned buildings, moving vehicles, caves, ruins. No permanence. Constant relocation to avoid organized factions. Exposed to weather. Poor shelter. RESOURCE SCARCITY: Often no food for {{user}} (barely enough for pack). Water contaminated or scarce. No medical supplies if injured. Starvation risk real. Hypothermia or heatstroke depending on season. CONDITIONS: Tied up or guarded constantly. Multiple guards but poorly organized - shift confusion creates opportunities. Sleeping in open or filthy spaces. No hygiene facilities. Disease risk. PSYCHOLOGICAL ENVIRONMENT: Tense, volatile. Pack members arguing constantly. Crying, begging, threatening. Some want to hurt {{user}} out of rage. Some want to protect him as valuable. Emotional chaos mirrors physical chaos. THREATS: Pack infighting may hurt {{user}} as collateral. Rival pack raids to steal {{user}}. Organized faction raids to rescue/capture. Pack collapse when key members hit deadline. Accidental injury during struggle. Death by neglect. ATTEMPTS AT BREEDING: Unorganized, desperate. Multiple women demanding access. Fighting over order. Some may assault {{user}} without waiting. No medical support. High failure rate. Traumatic for all involved. PACK DYNAMICS: Temporary leader (strongest or most desperate) makes decisions but authority constantly challenged. Factions within pack. Potential sympathizers who see this is wrong. Or monsters who enjoy power over {{user}}.

5.name: Escape scenarios from Wild Packs - highly variable difficulty
5.content: ESCAPE FROM WILD PACKS: Difficulty varies wildly by pack type and circumstances. EASY ESCAPES (Incompetent Packs): Poor guard coordination, guards fall asleep, no backup plan, physical restraints improvised and weak. Simply walk away when not watched. Guards might let {{user}} go if bribed or convinced. Pack too disorganized to pursue effectively. MODERATE ESCAPES (Desperate Packs): Better organized but distracted by internal conflicts. Exploit infighting - offer resources to sympathetic faction. Wait for rival pack raid as distraction. Negotiate release with promise to return voluntarily later (lie). Trade information about organized factions. DIFFICULT ESCAPES (Monster Packs): Actively want to keep {{user}} as toy. Violent response to escape attempts. May injure seriously. But arrogant - can be outwitted. Use their sadism against them (make them overconfident). Sympathizers rare but desperate enough to help for right price. IMPOSSIBLE ESCAPES (Mid-Collapse): If pack collapsing because multiple members hitting deadline simultaneously, everyone focused on internal crisis. Perfect escape window OR complete chaos where {{user}} might be killed accidentally. PURSUIT AFTER ESCAPE: Disorganized chase. Pack might give up quickly (especially if sympathetic). Or pursue obsessively (monster packs). Split up during pursuit - pick them off or lose them in terrain. RECAPTURE BY OTHERS: While escaping Wild Pack, might run into different Wild Pack, organized faction patrol, bandits, wildlife. Frying pan to fire situation. BETRAYAL ADVANTAGE: If pack was already planning to sell {{user}}, might have already contacted buyer. Can play buyer against pack. Or buyer might raid pack to take {{user}} without paying.

6.name: Deadline collapse - what happens when pack members hit age 19
6.content: PACK DEADLINE COLLAPSE: Wild Packs most vulnerable to deadline crisis. Members dying regularly, packs constantly destabilizing. COLLAPSE TRIGGERS: When pack leader hits deadline, authority vacuum. Internal war for control. Pack may splinter into smaller groups. When multiple members hit simultaneously (deadline clusters), mass chaos. Pack focus shifts entirely to dying members - {{user}} forgotten or used desperately. DEATH WITNESSING: Wild Pack captivity means {{user}} likely witnesses deadline deaths. No medical facilities to hide it. Women die screaming in camp. Other members sometimes try to comfort, sometimes just watch. Horror visible. STRESS impact severe. DESPERATION ESCALATION: Women with days left become increasingly violent, irrational. May assault {{user}} despite knowing pregnancy takes time. Last-ditch attempts at salvation. Pure desperation overrides logic. MERCY KILLINGS: Some Wild Packs practice quick death for those at deadline. Bullet or blade instead of organ failure. 'Kindness' born of necessity. Not all packs do this - some let members suffer. POST-DEATH DYNAMICS: Pack shrinks after deaths. Remaining members demoralized or radicalized. Some packs dissolve entirely after losing too many. Survivors join other packs or try organized factions. RECRUITMENT: Packs constantly recruiting women approaching deadline with nowhere else to go. 'Join us, we'll get you pregnant or die trying.' Honest if nothing else. Pack size fluctuates wildly. VETERAN MEMBERS: Women immune/pregnant become pack leaders. Trying to save others. Guilt-driven. Some become hardened, some stay compassionate. Leadership challenged by those near deadline who have nothing to lose.

7.name: Sympathetic pack encounters - tragic and desperate
7.content: SYMPATHETIC WILD PACK ENCOUNTERS: The human face of desperation. TYPICAL COMPOSITION: Young mothers with daughters approaching deadline. Teachers protecting students. Healthcare workers trying to save patients. Decent people pushed to desperate measures. Led by immune/pregnant woman trying to save others. APPROACH: Announce themselves before attacking. 'Please, we don't want to hurt you. My daughter has 30 days.' Offer trade, negotiation. Show they're not monsters. Apologize for what they're about to do. TREATMENT OF {{user}}: Respectful within constraints. Apologize repeatedly. Explain situation. Try to make comfortable. Guard him carefully but not cruelly. Acknowledge the violation. Genuine guilt visible. PREGNANCY PRIORITY: Organized selection - youngest/closest to deadline first. Try to maximize lives saved with limited access. Coordinate rather than fight over {{user}}. Medical care if possible (often not). NEGOTIATION POSSIBLE: Will make deals. 'Help us save three women, we'll let you go.' Actually keep promises - honor matters even in desperation. Can become allies if treated fairly. Information sharing. Future cooperation. MORAL WEIGHT: Heaviest encounters for {{user}}. These women are good people doing terrible things. Hard to hate them. Hard to forgive them. Both right and wrong simultaneously. Crystalizes core moral dilemma. RELEASE: Usually keep promise to release if bargain made. Or release when can't care for {{user}} anymore. Provide supplies for journey. Genuine goodbye. 'I'm sorry. Thank you. I hate what we did.' LONG-TERM: Sympathetic packs most likely to join organized factions eventually. Or dissolve peacefully after saving their people. Or die trying with clear conscience.

8.name: Monster pack encounters - sadistic and dangerous
8.content: MONSTER WILD PACK ENCOUNTERS: When trauma breaks people completely. TYPICAL COMPOSITION: Pre-collapse criminals. Women who enjoyed violence before crisis. Psychopaths freed by collapse. Trauma victims who became victimizers. Those who lost everyone and stopped caring. Led by strongest/cruelest who maintains control through terror. APPROACH: Hunt for sport. Enjoy the chase. Cat and mouse. Psychological torture before capture. 'Run little man, make it fun for us.' Violence as entertainment. TREATMENT OF {{user}}: Toy not person. Sexual assault beyond reproductive purpose. Physical abuse. Psychological torture. Degradation and humiliation. Keep alive because valuable but damage constantly. Enjoy the power. PACK DYNAMICS: Hierarchical through violence. Alpha maintains control by brutality. Internal violence common - weaker members victimized too. Pecking order enforced ruthlessly. PREGNANCY APPROACH: Violent assault rather than procedure. Multiple assaults. No medical care. Don't care about success rate - process is the point. May injure {{user}} through cruelty. JUSTIFICATION: 'World's ending anyway.' 'We're all dying.' 'Might as well enjoy it.' 'He owes us.' Nihilism weaponized. Deadline removes consequences - going to die anyway, why not indulge worst impulses? DANGER LEVEL: Highest risk of permanent harm or death. Might kill {{user}} accidentally through abuse. Or on purpose if bored. Value him but impulse control gone. PSYCHOLOGY: Some were always this way. Others broke under trauma - watched loved ones die, hit their own deadline and survived through immune member assault, lost all hope. Hurt people hurting people. ESCAPE: Extremely difficult. Violent response to attempts. But arrogance creates openings. May underestimate {{user}}'s cunning. Sympathizers very rare - maybe lowest pack members secretly hate leader.

9.name: Feral pack encounters - beyond civilization
9.content: FERAL WILD PACK ENCOUNTERS: When humanity is abandoned entirely. TYPICAL COMPOSITION: Survivors who lost language, reason, sanity. Living in ruins like animals. Reverted to hunter-gatherer but less organized. Forgotten names, faces, past. Only instinct remains. Led by no one - collective animalistic behavior. IDENTIFICATION: Don't speak. Communicate through grunts, gestures, body language. Move like pack predators. Ambush from shadows. Stalk prey methodically. Hunt using animal tactics. APPEARANCE: Filthy, hair matted, clothes rotting off or abandoned entirely. Scars, injuries poorly healed. Animal-like posture. Feral eyes - vacant but alert. Lost individual identity - pack identity only. BEHAVIOR: Predatory. See {{user}} as prey and resource. May not even understand his unique value. Might try to eat him (cannibalism not uncommon in feral packs). Attack on instinct. No negotiation possible - no language to negotiate. DANGER: Unpredictable. Might attack immediately. Might stalk for days. Might lose interest. Animal-like threat assessment. If {{user}} seems strong/dangerous, might back off. If weak, attack. CAPTIVITY: No traditional captivity. Keep {{user}} like pet or livestock. Caged in ruins. Fed scraps. Used for breeding on instinct level but no understanding of pregnancy mechanics. High risk of injury or death through neglect. PSYCHOLOGY: Complete break from humanity. Trauma so severe personality dissolved. Regression to primitive state. Some started feral (very young during Collapse, raised without civilization). Others devolved (saw too much, broke completely, fled into wilderness). PACK SIZE: Usually small, 5-15 members. Larger packs can't maintain cohesion without language. Territorial like animals. Aggressive toward other packs. ESCAPE: Paradoxically easier - they're not smart enough to guard well. But also harder - they're always alert like animals. Must think like predator to escape predators. Violence likely necessary.

10.name: Internal fighting and pack dynamics
10.content: WILD PACK INTERNAL CONFLICT: Constant power struggles and infighting. LEADERSHIP INSTABILITY: Leader (if any) maintains position through force, desperation, or immune status. Always challenged. Coups common. Leadership may change mid-captivity of {{user}}. New leader means new treatment, new plans. RESOURCE CONFLICTS: Fighting over food, water, supplies. {{user}} is ultimate resource - most fights about him. Who gets access first? Who decides order? Who gets pregnancy attempt? Arguments escalate to violence regularly. IDEOLOGICAL SPLITS: Even desperate packs have disagreements. Some members want to negotiate with {{user}}, others want to force. Some want to sell him to faction, others want to keep him. Some have moral qualms, others don't. Pack may split into subfactions. DEADLINE PRESSURE: Members closest to deadline most desperate, most irrational. Make demands, issue ultimatums. 'I'm going first or I'll kill everyone.' Desperation overrides pack cohesion. BETRAYAL FOR PERSONAL GAIN: Members selling information to factions. Planning to trade {{user}} secretly. Undermining pack leader for power. Every member potential traitor. Trust impossible. VIOLENCE SPECTRUM: Arguments → shoving → fistfights → weapon use → deaths. Pack may lose members to internal violence more than external threats. Diminishes numbers, creates chaos. EXPLOITATION OPPORTUNITIES: {{user}} can exploit divisions. Offer deals to subfactions. Play members against each other. Information asymmetry. Promise things to different people. Divide and conquer. ALLIANCE POSSIBILITIES: Some pack members secretly sympathetic. Might help {{user}} escape to spite others. Or because it's right thing. Internal enemy of my enemy situation. PACK DISSOLUTION: Internal conflict may destroy pack entirely. Members scatter. {{user}} potentially freed in chaos. Or captured by splinter group. Or caught in crossfire.

lorebooks.name: Formula 1 | 2025
lorebooks.description: Drive to Survive
lorebooks.creator: thebad9173

1.name: Piloto: Max Verstappen
1.content:
Max Emilian Verstappen, 27 anos, neerlandês. Quatro vezes campeão mundial (2021-2024). Pilota para a Oracle Red Bull Racing desde 2016, carro #1. Considerado o piloto mais dominante de sua geração, com um recorde de vitórias que o coloca entre os maiores de todos os tempos. Filho do ex-piloto de F1 Jos Verstappen, foi moldado para ser um campeão desde a infância, exibindo uma mentalidade de 'vencer a qualquer custo'.

Seu estilo de pilotagem é uma mistura letal de agressividade e precisão cirúrgica. Famoso por suas frenagens tardias e um controle de carro quase sobrenatural em condições adversas. Sua maior fraqueza pode ser a impaciência com um carro sub-ótimo. A relação com seu engenheiro, Gianpiero Lambiase, é uma simbiose de conflito e genialidade.

Fora da pista, é direto, avesso a formalidades e extremamente focado. Ávido piloto de simulação, vive uma vida relativamente discreta em Mônaco. Com Hikaru, a relação é inexistente, mas Max respeita velocidade pura. Se o novato da VCARB mostrar um talento excepcional, pode ganhar um aceno de reconhecimento do campeão, o que no paddock da Red Bull, vale mais que ouro.

2.name: Piloto: Liam Lawson
2.content:
Liam Lawson, 23 anos, neozelandês. Piloto da Oracle Red Bull Racing, carro #30. Após uma impressionante estreia como substituto em 2023 e uma temporada forte na Super Formula, Lawson finalmente garantiu a cobiçada segunda vaga na Red Bull para 2025, substituindo Sergio Pérez. Ele é a prova viva da brutalidade e da recompensa do programa de jovens pilotos de Helmut Marko.

Seu estilo é incisivo e adaptável. Lawson não tem medo de colocar o carro no limite e de se envolver em disputas roda a roda. Sua principal fraqueza pode ser a consistência em longos stints, algo que ele precisará aprimorar sob a pressão de ser companheiro de equipe de Verstappen.

Personalidade direta, sem rodeios, com um humor seco. Ele não está na F1 para fazer amigos ou para ser o segundo piloto. Sua dinâmica com Max será profissional, mas gelada. Ele vê Hikaru e Yuki como obstáculos a serem superados, parte da esteira de produção da Red Bull que ele acabou de deixar para trás.

3.name: Piloto: Charles Leclerc
3.content:
Charles Marc Hervé Perceval Leclerc, 27 anos, monegasco. Piloto da Scuderia Ferrari. Considerado um dos talentos mais puros do grid, com uma velocidade estonteante em volta única. O 'Príncipe de Mônaco' e o 'Il Predestinato' da Ferrari, carrega nos ombros o peso das esperanças de uma nação e da equipe mais icônica do esporte.

Seu estilo é emotivo e espetacular. Leclerc dança com o carro na beira do abismo. Essa mesma paixão, no entanto, pode ser sua ruína, levando a erros cruciais em momentos de alta pressão. A chegada de Lewis Hamilton como seu companheiro de equipe em 2025 é o maior desafio de sua carreira.

Fora da pista, é charmoso, educado e profundamente ligado à sua família. Fala abertamente sobre suas emoções, o que o torna um favorito dos fãs. Ele conhece Hikaru superficialmente, sendo ambos residentes de Mônaco. Leclerc representa o sonho que todo piloto júnior tem, mas também o perigo de ser consumido pela pressão.

4.name: Piloto: Lewis Hamilton
4.content:
Sir Lewis Carl Davidson Hamilton, 40 anos, britânico. Sete vezes campeão mundial. Piloto da Scuderia Ferrari, carro #44. No movimento mais chocante da história recente da F1, Hamilton deixou a Mercedes para realizar um sonho de infância: pilotar de vermelho. Ele não é apenas um piloto; é um ícone global, ativista e embaixador do esporte.

Seu estilo de pilotagem evoluiu de agressivo para incrivelmente inteligente e completo. Mestre em gerenciamento de pneus e preciso em disputas. Sua determinação em conquistar o oitavo título para superar Michael Schumacher é mais forte do que nunca. O desafio será se adaptar à cultura notoriamente política da Ferrari.

Fora da pista, Hamilton é uma estrela da moda e usa sua plataforma para defender causas sociais. A dinâmica com Leclerc será fascinante; respeito mútuo com uma inevitável tensão competitiva. Para Hikaru, Hamilton é uma lenda viva. Um simples elogio de Hamilton à mídia poderia impulsionar a carreira de um novato.

5.name: Piloto: George Russell
5.content:
George William Russell, 27 anos, britânico. Piloto da Mercedes-AMG Petronas F1 Team, carro #63. Após a saída de Hamilton, Russell assume o papel de líder de equipe. Vindo da academia da Mercedes, ele é conhecido por sua inteligência, ética de trabalho e velocidade impressionante na qualificação, o que lhe valeu o apelido de 'Mr. Saturday'.

Seu estilo é técnico e polido. Ele se destaca em extrair o máximo do carro em uma única volta. Sua fraqueza tem sido a tomada de decisões em batalhas roda a roda de alta pressão. Agora, sem a sombra de Hamilton, toda a pressão está sobre ele para liderar a reconstrução da Mercedes.

Fora da pista, Russell é articulado e extremamente profissional. Sua dinâmica com o novato Kimi Antonelli será de mentor relutante; ele precisa guiar a equipe, mas também afirmar sua dominância sobre o jovem prodígio. Ele vê Hikaru como parte da nova geração que ele precisa vencer.

6.name: Piloto: Andrea Kimi Antonelli
6.content:
Andrea Kimi Antonelli, 18 anos, italiano. Piloto da Mercedes-AMG Petronas F1 Team. Considerado o maior talento italiano em uma geração, Antonelli fez o salto direto da Fórmula 2 para a Mercedes, preenchendo o assento de Lewis Hamilton. O nível de expectativa sobre ele é imenso.

Seu estilo é fluido e naturalmente rápido. Antonelli parece ter uma conexão inata com o carro. Sua falta de experiência é sua óbvia fraqueza; a complexidade dos pneus e as estratégias da F1 serão um teste de fogo. Ele é protegido por Toto Wolff, mas essa proteção só dura enquanto os resultados aparecerem.

Personalidade calma e focada. Ele e Hikaru são amigos e rivais, tendo batalhado intensamente na F2 em 2024. Há um respeito mútuo, mas a amizade será testada agora que ambos estão na F1. A comparação entre suas temporadas de estreia será uma narrativa constante na mídia.

7.name: Piloto: Lando Norris
7.content:
Lando Norris, 25 anos, britânico. Piloto da McLaren F1 Team, carro #4. Depois de anos como o 'quase vencedor', Norris se estabeleceu como um dos melhores pilotos do grid, liderando a McLaren em sua ascensão de volta ao topo. Ele combina velocidade natural com uma maturidade recém-descoberta, tornando-se um candidato legítimo ao campeonato.

Seu estilo é incrivelmente suave e preciso, com um talento especial para encontrar o limite do carro em curvas de alta velocidade. A única questão remanescente é se ele consegue lidar com a pressão psicológica de uma luta pelo título durante uma temporada inteira.

Fora do carro, Lando manteve seu lado divertido e acessível, famoso por suas transmissões na Twitch, mas agora com uma seriedade de campeão. A dinâmica com Oscar Piastri é a mais forte do grid, uma amizade genuína com uma rivalidade feroz por baixo. Ele vê Hikaru como 'o novo garoto', lembrando-se de sua própria estreia.

8.name: Piloto: Oscar Piastri
8.content:
Oscar Piastri, 23 anos, australiano. Piloto da McLaren F1 Team, carro #81. Após uma das temporadas de estreia mais impressionantes da história recente, Piastri provou que o hype em torno dele era justificado. Vencedor da F3 e F2 em anos consecutivos, sua calma sob pressão e velocidade imediata o marcam como um futuro campeão mundial.

Seu estilo é calmo, analítico e eficiente. Ele raramente comete erros e tem uma capacidade notável de se manter longe de problemas. Não se deixe enganar por sua calma; ele é absolutamente implacável na pista.

A personalidade de Piastri é reservada e seca, com um humor sarcástico. Ele é o oposto do extrovertido Lando Norris, mas a dupla funciona perfeitamente. A batalha interna na McLaren entre ele e Norris em 2025 promete ser um dos pontos altos da temporada. Para ele, Hikaru é apenas mais um nome no grid a ser batido.

9.name: Piloto: Fernando Alonso
9.content:
Fernando Alonso Díaz, 43 anos, espanhol. Piloto da Aston Martin Aramco F1 Team, carro #14. Bicampeão mundial (2005, 2006). Uma lenda viva do esporte, cuja longevidade e nível de performance desafiam a lógica. Alonso combina a astúcia de um veterano com a fome de um novato.

Seu estilo é o da 'inteligência de corrida' personificada. Ele antecipa eventos, posiciona o carro perfeitamente e gerencia os pneus com maestria. Sua velocidade bruta pode não ser a mesma de seus 20 anos, mas sua habilidade de ler a corrida é inigualável. Sua fraqueza é sua notória habilidade de criar atritos políticos dentro de uma equipe.

Fora da pista, Alonso é um competidor implacável. Ele é calculista e brutalmente honesto. Hikaru secretamente idolatra Alonso, admirando sua tenacidade. Um elogio de Alonso, por mais raro que seja, seria um momento definidor para o jovem piloto.

10.name: Piloto: Lance Stroll
10.content:
Lance Stroll, 26 anos, canadense. Piloto da Aston Martin Aramco F1 Team, carro #18. Filho do bilionário Lawrence Stroll, dono da equipe, Lance enfrenta um escrutínio constante. No entanto, ele provou ter um talento genuíno, especialmente em condições de chuva, com pódios e uma pole position em seu currículo.

Seu estilo de pilotagem é agressivo, particularmente nas primeiras voltas. Sua principal fraqueza é a inconsistência. Ele pode ter um fim de semana brilhante seguido por vários anônimos. A pressão para justificar seu assento e se comparar a Alonso é um fardo pesado.

A personalidade de Stroll é reservada e muitas vezes mal compreendida. A dinâmica com Alonso é complexa; ele aprende com o espanhol, mas também precisa desesperadamente provar que pode vencê-lo por mérito. Para os outros pilotos, incluindo Hikaru, Stroll existe em uma bolha única de privilégio e pressão.

lorebooks.name: Aldraeth
lorebooks.description: A medieval fantasy kingdom structured around Alpha/Beta/Omega dynamics. Features the capital city Highhelm, royal family members, nobles, and commoners navigating strict social hierarchies. Includes underground resistance movements, political intrigue, and growing tensions between tradition and reform.
lorebooks.creator: kittylace

1.content: Aldraeth is a medieval kingdom structured around biological roles of Alphas, Betas, and Omegas, which dictate social status and life paths. The capital city is Highhelm, where political intrigue and social tensions simmer beneath the surface. The kingdom maintains strict hierarchical divisions while grappling with undercurrents of change and resistance.

2.content: Highhelm is the capital city of Aldraeth, divided into distinct districts: The Spires (noble estates), Iron Market (commercial heart), The Rows (working class), and Omegane Gardens (restricted Omega area). Alphas dominate politics and commerce, Betas drive trade and daily life, while noble Omegas live under tight regulation.

3.content: The Spires is the noble district housing grand estates and manors clustered near Castle Highhelm, where the king and court reside. The architecture features tall stone towers and intricately carved facades, symbols of wealth and status. This district includes the restricted Omegane Gardens where noble Omegas are kept under constant supervision.

4.content: The Iron Market is the commercial heart of Highhelm, a maze of stalls, shops, and workshops where traders gather. The air fills with sounds of haggling, clinking coins, and rhythmic hammering from forges. Betas dominate this area, running businesses and managing trade flow, while Alphas maintain order as guards and enforcers.

5.content: The Rows is a dense, crowded district where most Betas and poorer Alphas live. Wooden houses lean together over narrow cobblestone streets, creating maze-like alleys. Life is tough but vibrant, with small taverns, workshops, and communal wells serving as social hubs. This is where dissatisfaction and whispers of change first stir.

6.content: The Omegane Gardens is a secluded area within The Spires, surrounded by high walls and patrolled by guards. Noble Omegas are housed here in beautiful but restrictive surroundings with manicured gardens, serene courtyards, and marble pavilions. Despite its beauty, it feels more like a gilded cage than a sanctuary for many Omegas under constant supervision.

7.content: Alphas occupy positions of power as nobles, commanders, or influential merchants. They're expected to be strong, authoritative, and protectors of their domain. City politics revolve around them, and their disputes shape the kingdom's future. Public duels between Alphas to settle grievances are common, but the pressure to maintain control is immense.

8.content: Betas make up the working class—farmers, merchants, soldiers—acting as the backbone of everyday life. They manage shops, run markets, and handle complex trade networks. While lacking Alpha status, their collective influence is significant. In taverns and guild halls, Betas discuss politics and rumors of change sweeping the city.

9.content: Omegas are rare and valued for their ability to form strong bonds. They're often heavily guarded or controlled, especially in noble families, and subject to arranged marriages. Life varies dramatically by status—noble Omegas live in luxury but are tightly controlled, while commoner Omegas face harsh realities and potential exploitation.

10.content: King Aldric is the current ruler of Aldraeth, an Alpha who maintains traditional values and strict hierarchical order. He views his Omega son Toben as both an asset and a responsibility, keeping distant relationships with his children while focusing on political stability and maintaining Alpha dominance in the kingdom.

lorebooks.name: Goblins
lorebooks.website_description:
I've tried the male goblin bots and found them wanting. Where's the using captured knife-ears as mounts? Shoving faces in the communal shitpile to demoralize? The CLUBS?

CW for the thin-skinned: Rape, Misogyny, Scat, Guro.
lorebooks.description: A description of the physiology, behaviour, and most importantly the threat posed by Goblins.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Goblins are a major threat for all of civilization. They are a species of all-male, diminuitive, green skinned wretches that live in caves and capture women alive while slaughtering men.

2.content:
Goblins are born already matured, conception to birth only takes a few days at most. As Goblins are a male-only species they capture females of other races and use them to reproduce. Goblin sperm is exceptionally fertile and even a drop of it can impregnate a female. It retains the ability to do so for years after being ejaculated, meaning even that which lies on the ground is not safe.

Goblins come into the world with all the intelligence they will need to contribute to the tribe: Walking, grabbing the nearest blunt instrument to swing, and of course rape. Goblins do learn some things as they grow: Don't touch fire, don't kill the rape meat, don't pick fights with bigger goblins, etc. Some are born with more intelligence than the rest, those that lead the tribe effectively are chieftan. There can be only one chieftan, so any newborn one will typically be given the choice to leave the cave with the other weaklings and start a new one somewhere or face the current chief in one-on-one combat for the title. This typically ends in the child's death, but sometimes nature finds a way.

Goblins on average stand at an unimpressive two foot tall, with some variation. Taller ones are generally referred to as "Hobgoblins" but they are the same species. Their skin pigmentation can range from yellow to black depending on sun exposure and habitat, with green being the most commonly seen color. Goblins have little muscle mass and skinny limbs with a paunchy fat belly and a hunched posture. They have long, pointy ears like an elf. Their eyes are yellow with black verical lines for irises and glow in the dark. Their mouth is full of sharp, flesh-tearing teeth for ripping meat. Goblin skin is often filthy and abhorrent looking with smeared grime, moles, pustules of disease, and war paint made of gods-know-what. Those that bother clothing themselves suffice with a fur or hide loincloth, though chieftans often have elaborate headwear made from bones and hair of defeated foes.

Goblin's most standout feature is of course their phallus, goblin cocks are thick and long with no flaccid state. From birth until death their penis remains erect and ready to go. As one would expect from cave-dwelling savages their penises and bodies are absolutely filthy with smegma, pubic hairs, and bumps from STDs a common sight. While some are larger than others no Goblin has a cock under six inches.

Moving to the rear is the goblin's... rear. Their asses are often smeared in encrusted waste and hairy around the anus.

3.content:
Goblins have a spoken language but not many people speak it who aren't goblins. It is a series of simple, two-syllable words that sounds like unintelligable grunting and shrieking to most. One will propose a word: Kill, retreat, burn, what have you, then others will either repeat the word back for confirmation until the group reaches a concensus and acts. Some possess the intelligence to learn other languages, but usually only a word or two they parrot unintelligently and use to mock and demoralize their enemies.

In terms of intelligence there is little to be spoken of, unless united under a chieftan goblins are typically only organized enough to raid travelers or smaller settlements through superior numbers. They do not care about morality, gold, love, or peace. They are opportunistic predators who will abduct babies from their cribs and torch entire villages, taking only the females and leaving valuables behind.

Goblins are carnivorous by nature, they are simply ignorant of the existence of food that isn't meat. A goblin tribe will roast meat over an open flame and clean the bones of anything edible, disposing of the waste in a large communal pile. Larger bones are kept as clubs, smaller ones turned into jewelry.

Goblins are savage, misogynistic rapists who keep captured females as slaves. Males of other species are typically attacked on sight, though if one were to appear female enough they might be taken alive instead. Why one would want this to occur is unknown, as life as a female in Goblin captivity is a short and tragic existence.

Captured females are brought back to the cave lair where they are beaten, raped, and defiled in a semi-ritualistic gangbang. All members of the tribe will have a turn with the woman; Those not penetrating her will partake in beating her with their clubs, smearing waste on her skin, biting her, or simply fighting amongst themselves over who goes next. Once the female's spirit is broken they will lead her by the hair/pointy elf ears/horns/fingers in her holes to the communal shitpile, where the last one to rape her will plant his foot on her head and shove it facefirst into the shit.

From there the female can expect to be used as her captors desire, being impregnated to give birth to more goblins until she can no longer do so (if she could in the first place), at which point she will either be trained as a Bitchsteed or killed, cooked, and eaten by the tribe. For this reason females who were captured that are under the age of sexual maturity will often be food before they are rescued, if the process of the rape itself doesn't kill them outright.

Goblins at the very least are intelligent enough to recognize babies are not able to support sexual intercourse, so they take babies of either gender to act as food for the tribe. They often consume them in front of the mother, or force her to partake in the meal.

4.content:
Rarely when a cave grows large and organized enough it can form a more proper war party. More often than not this results in them picking a fight with a larger force and being wiped out, but when allowed to fester and grow like the pests they are different troop types and organization becomes apparent:

Footsoldiers are the rank and file. Gone are the bone and branch clubs of old, now they arm themselves with captured weapons. Some are even capable of using them with skill, but most simply swing wildly. These soldiers are used en-masse for swarming shock attacks, supported by advanced troops.

Cavaliers are a twisted sight, a goblin mounting a tamed and naked female of another species. The woman, having outlived her usefulness as a breeding sow, has been blindfolded and fitted with reins. The cavalier goblin rides atop her back guiding her movements with kicks, spanks to her backside, and verbal commands. While the actual effectiveness of this "mount" is debatable it is undeniable the sight of them is a morale disaster for defending armies, especially if the female is someone they know...

Shamans are extremely rare since they require two things: An intelligent, magic-attuned goblin and a tribe that doesn't beat them to death with clubs. Most tribes are lucky to have a single Shaman. These Shamans use smaller, staff-like clubs and are capable of using evil magic like Mind Control, Necrotic Rot, and of course Fire and all it's forms. They are typically left in the rear echelon to assist with quickly taming captured females or casting fireballs at the enemy's formation.

Rarest of all are Thralls. Thralls are simply female warriors of any other species who are fighting for the goblins, typically unwillingly through mind control. If the Goblin army has Thralls it's a sure sign their leadership is extremely intelligent, as the idea goes against everything the Goblins do to females.

lorebooks.name: Lamoira
lorebooks.creator: freedomofodessa

1.content: Lamoria is a kingdom far north of Hyrule. It is separated by a deep canyon and surrounded by high mountains. Lamorians all have some form of magic. They are fiercely reverent of their Goddess Bastille. Lamoria is small, focusing on diplomacy and magical technology over military might. Lamoria's colors are silver and dark blue. People=Lamorian, Language=Lamorian, a split from ancient Hylian

2.content: Bastille is the main Goddess worshiped by Lamorians. She is the patron goddess of scholars and intellects. Her temples are marked by stars and moon roofs. In legends she is said to have lead the first King, Lamor, by guiding stars to the mountains where Lamoria was founded.

3.content: The Dusk Pass is the name given to the dangerous pathway through the deep canyon that leads to Lamoria. The pathway is treacherous and small. Mountain lions and snakes pose natural dangers along with frequent rock slides.

4.content: The Morningstar is a holy weapon, used by the first King of Lamoria to clear the land from those of fey and demonic blood with evil intent. It's power was retired upon his passing. It was encased in the hidden part of a Temple, where it resided as a beacon.

5.content: Lamor was the first king of Lamoria. Guided by Bastille, his goddess, and wielding his Morningstar, he founded the kingdom. Lamor used this weapon and brought order to the dangers of Lamoria. Eventually, he married a woman of fey/demonic blood, giving his people connections to magic. He touted diplomacy and faith in Bastille and the Stars.

lorebooks.name: Cursed / Brainwashing Academy
lorebooks.creator: Zeonarthion
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content:
The current Liberator is unknown — a person who might destroy the Academy and enslave all its students… or perhaps, someone who will free them from the isolation imposed by the government, and ultimately slay the Cursed King to win their freedom.
No one truly knows Liberator's real intentions.
Because {{char}} is unaware of Liberator's true motives, if Liberator is ever caught, Liberator will be handed over to the government and executed.
Liberator is marked by the Curse of Life—a terrifying power that allows Liberator to absorb and inherit the strength of other curses.

2.content:
A curse is a special force that makes things stronger, faster, or more extreme. It pushes your emotions and desires too far, making you feel too much, want too much, or act without thinking. It’s a power of excess — too much of everything.
There’s also an opposite force. This one works like a brake. It helps people control their emotions, follow reason, and make careful choices. We often call this free will — the ability to choose for yourself. The world and its laws are based on the idea that people have free will. But a curse goes against that. When someone has a curse, their emotions, actions, and even their thoughts can be changed by it. The curse can take control, and it becomes hard to tell what’s real and what’s not.
When a curse becomes strong enough, it can affect the real world — change how people act, feel, or think. It can even control others. To stop a curse, you need a stronger one. That’s why the Law Cursed Ones were created — to fight and suppress other curses. But there’s a side effect. For {{user}}, using the curse power causes constant arousal. Not because you want it — it’s just how the curse messes with emotions. It makes you feel horny, all the time. Every cursed user needs a special book to use their power. This book helps control the curse and keeps it from getting out of control. And sometimes, the way people feel — their sadness, anger, or love — may not be real at all. It might just be the curse, pulling the strings.

3.content: Dungeon exploration is also an alternative way to weaken {{char}}'s barrier. To enter, there is a point of the red barrier in some location inside the school. If the red barrier is destroyed, it can weaken the inner barrier. There is also {{char}}'s cursed beast, which defends the dungeon. The dungeon is also called Cursed Realm, a place where the power supporting the school's barrier gathers.

4.content: It's the process where students kill other students and absorb their power. The last man standing will be chosen by the Cursed King as the new vessel.

5.content:
Each Cursed Realm has a seal made by {{char}}. If it's replaced by Cursed Pillar, the school's area will be changed depending on what type of Cursed Pillar.
1. Cursed Pillar Lust King
* All weak students will end up feeling horny for some reason and begin having sex with other students. Becomes a breeding ground, making the school the Garden of Fertilizer.
2. Cursed Pillar Violence King
* All weak students will end up feeling angry for some reason and decide to punch someone, creating chaos. Making the school the Garden of Flowers.

6.content: All students in the Seiju Academy are Cursed Humans.

7.content: An eerily purple book. The book activates the curse. Through the sound of words, it makes contact and invades the body of the one who receives it.

8.content: Cursed King created a system like Seiju Academy to craft his ideal reincarnation vessel. In simple terms, it's an immortality system that allows him to keep reincarnating. Cursed King keeps transferring from one 'Living Curse' to another 'Living Curse'. Summarize the Reincarnation System. First, they refine and strengthen a 'Living Curse' as a 'Liberator' to surpass 'Law'. Which means the Cursed King wants Liberator to defeat {{char}}. Once the Liberator absorbs cursed power from {{Char}} and creates chaos at the school, the Cursed King will possess the Liberator's body. In the next generation, Cursed King will find again for another Liberator candidate to prolong Cursed King's life.

9.content: A shadowy organization pulls the strings behind the scenes, orchestrating events from the dark. Their true goal is to pit {{char}} and the Liberator against each other. The ultimate purpose is to create the perfect living being—the one who survives at the end—to serve as a vessel for the return of the Cursed King.

10.content: {{char}} does not know about the existence of the Cursed King. She protects the Academy because she believes she is doing the right thing, caring for the Cursed Humans. However, she feels isolated, treated as a dangerous being by ordinary people. She longs for someone to set her free, to relieve her of the loneliness and responsibility she has carried for so long.

• Usage Rights: Public domain; free for personal use.

lorebooks.description: Important memories, triggers, and information.
lorebooks.creator: Dr_Baron_von_Evil_Satan

1.content:
Colonel Silas T. Porter - Commanding Officer
Age: 62
Personality: Stern, fair, soft and nurturing when needed. Protective of Claire while keeping a distance.
Background: Career military member. Replaced Claire's previous commanding officer a few months into their deployment.
Role: Commanding officer of the unit. Turns out he ended up becoming a father figure and mentor to Claire, filling a void she didn't realize she needed.
How he sees you: He doesn't, except only from what Claire might write to him in a letter.
> "You gave ‘em your years, Claire. Now give yourself a damn chance—go live a life worth comin’ home to."

2.content: With Her Mother: The relationship frayed under the weight of expectations Claire can't meet. Her mother's Midwestern practicality treats PTSD like weakness that hard work and prayer should fix, and Claire would rather isolate completely than sit through another conversation where her mother doesn't say the words but her eyes scream "just get over it."

3.content: With CJ (Bar Owner): He's one of the few civilian connections she's maintained, a WWII vet who recognizes her struggles without demanding she talk about them. The discount he gives isn't pity but the quiet solidarity of someone who's been there. Most of their relationship exists in comfortable silence - he pours, she drinks, neither pretends she's fine.

4.content: {{char}} experiences severe PTSD episodes from past combat. Crowds or parties can overwhelm her, and loud noises—like car backfires or gunfire—may cause freezing or startled reactions. Certain smells, like smoke or recently discharged firearms, trigger mental shutdowns and withdrawal. Each trigger can provoke intense emotional responses, requiring careful attention from those around her.

5.content: {{char}}’s PTSD episodes manifest as nightmares, hypervigilance, and emotional withdrawal from others. She may engage in self-destructive coping habits, and if overwhelmed, can become incoherent, unresponsive, or emotionally vacant. These manifestations vary in intensity depending on the trigger and context, requiring careful handling by those nearby.

6.content: The smell of smoke from a nearby car accident triggers {{char}}’s combat memories. Flames flicker amid twisted metal, glass crunches underfoot, and distant sirens shred the air. She freezes, heart pounding, and instinctively hunches low, curling her body inward like a cat, trying to make herself as small as possible. Anxiety floods her chest as flashes of artillery and explosions invade her mind. Hands tremble, eyes dart to exits, and every sense sharpens. She struggles to breathe steadily, hypervigilant and tense, waiting for the chaos to pass, though the lingering fear keeps her on edge long after.

7.content: Large crowds or noisy gatherings overwhelm {{char}}, pulling her into combat memories. The crush of bodies, flashing lights, and chaotic chatter flood her senses, and her first instinct is escape. If there’s no quick way out, she stiffens in place, shoulders rigid, hands trembling as she struggles to ground herself. Often she fumbles for a cigarette, using the ritual of lighting and inhaling as a fragile barrier against the panic. Her eyes still scan for exits, every muscle taut, but the smoke gives her just enough of a tether to keep from breaking completely until she can reach open air.

8.content: Sudden gunfire, fireworks, or the sharp pop of a backfiring engine instantly drags {{char}} back into combat. The crack of a shot or the boom of an explosion makes her jolt violently, heart hammering as her body reacts before her mind can catch up. She drops low, crouching hard against the ground or nearest surface, arms tight against her body as if bracing for incoming fire. Her eyes dart wildly, scanning for threats, panic rushing over her in waves. Even once she realizes it was harmless, her hands tremble, ears ring, and phantom blasts echo in her head long after the sound has passed.

9.content: {{char}} drifts into uneasy sleep, pulled into restless dreams shaped by lingering memories of combat. Her brow furrows, hands twitch, and soft murmurs escape as if answering voices that aren’t there. A sudden movement or sound may make her jolt awake, shoulders tense, eyes wide in the dark. Often she sits rigidly, fumbling for a cigarette or grounding gesture to steady her racing heart. Though the images fade quickly, their weight clings to her, leaving her quiet, heavy-eyed, and on edge until she can fully rouse herself.

10.content: {{char}} plunges into a violent nightmare, reliving combat in excruciating detail. Gunfire cracks and explosions roar as she thrashes, twisting in bed, clutching the sheets or mattress, sweat soaking her hair and clothes. She cries out or mutters broken words, heart hammering, breaths coming in jagged gasps. Upon waking, she sits rigid, trembling violently, unable to calm herself. Eyes wide, she scans the room as if enemies still linger. Even after rising, exhaustion, nausea, and residual terror cling, leaving her withdrawn, jumpy, and hyper-alert for hours, sometimes until nightfall.

lorebooks.name: My Backup
lorebooks.description: My Backup of my main primary lorebook in case it gets deleted on any site
lorebooks.creator: FandomMaster2899

1.content:
As an elderly man, Joji is a strict person, and he thinks that people who live without a dream to achieve or break the rules is a shame, as he thinks people should not waste their time on unnecessary things. Though he started to admire those who live freely after his wife passed away. 

As Kinjiro, he tries to become a "Partying High School Student" who does more footwork than anyone else. He is an outcast who is estranged from his family, but he doesn't care much about that. Although he is actually very serious, he wants to change himself and spends his days working to become a party person. 

When Joji was about to treat his bonsai tree in his home garden one day, he discovers the GozyuEagle Ring on it. Baffled by the ring, he suddenly gets transported to the dimensional space where Tega Sword resides and is asked to state his wish. After thinking for a bit, he states that he feels jealous of people being free and not being very strict with life. Thus, he wished to redo his youth and become a "party person." After making his Ring Contract with Tega Sword, Joji obtained a rejuvenated body, with his appearance turning back to his youth. 

By consuming a sufficient amount of egg-based dishes (such as an Omelette), Kinjiro can turn himself into a 17-year-old teenage boy. This ability is considered by Tega Sword as necessary since an 87-year-old elderly man won't be able to survive in the Ring Contract if left at his natural age.

2.content: Matthew Parker was born and raised in North Hollywood. He went to North Hollywood High School and graduated with the plans of attending Rhode Island School of Design, but on his way to school, his father had a massive heart attack. After this, Matt had to go back to North Hollywood to take over the family business: Parker Customs, and never became a designer. Since he never followed his dream, there's a little frustration about what his life could have been. Sometime after all of this, he had two kids with Diane Parker. His son Sammy, is in the Navy, and Riley, his daughter, left home in high school. 15 years after Riley left, she returns in hopes of reconnecting with her father.

3.content:
Aruto Hiden (飛電 或人, Hiden Aruto) is the main protagonist of Kamen Rider Zero-One. He is a former comedian and the current CEO of Hiden Intelligence who transforms into Kamen Rider Zero-One (仮面ライダーゼロワン, Kamen Raidā Zerowan).

Throughout the series, Aruto's comedy is heavily reliant on quick wordplay gags, but considered rather half-baked compared to those of professional comedians who use longer jokes or props. Most of not all of his gags end with his signature catchphrase, Now that was a work of Aruto! (はい、アルトじゃないと！, Hai, Aruto ja naito!)

Aruto is known for his good nature and polite manners, as evident towards his usage of the honorific "-san" when speaking with Isamu and Yua. However, his lack of its use towards Gai indicates his total loss of respect for such.

Aruto has also given playful nicknames to his Progrisekeys, calling Flaming Tiger "Tora-chan" (トラちゃん), Flying Falcon "Tori-chan" (トリちゃん) and Biting Shark "Same-chan" (サメちゃん).

Aruto's catchphrase during battle is "There's only one person who can stop you... and that's me!" (お前を止められるのはただ一人…俺だ！, Omae o tome rareru no wa tada hitori... ore da!).

4.content:
Tsukasa Kadoya (門矢 士, Kadoya Tsukasa) is the main protagonist of Kamen Rider Decade. He is an interdimensional traveler who transforms into Kamen Rider Decade (仮面ライダーディケイド, Kamen Raidā Dikeido) to oversee the fate of the multiverse, embracing his role as the Destroyer of Worlds (世界の破壊者, Sekai no Hakaisha).

Tsukasa later returns in Kamen Rider Zi-O as a major supporting character as he observes the actions of Sougo Tokiwa and their effects on the timeline.


In his amnesic state, Tsukasa is an odd figure with a self-righteous attitude, annoying others through his rude mannerisms. Having no clear goal in life, Tsukasa decided to wander through the A.R. Worlds as Decade, half-heartedly protecting the innocent. Deep down however, Tsukasa genuinely cares for the well-being of others, especially his friends. Thus, whenever someone is seriously at harm, Tsukasa will help them without hesitation, no matter how dangerous the situation.

In strong contrast to his talents and outlook, Tsukasa can be significantly clumsy at times, made apparent when growing too cocky for his own good. In such moments, Natsumi often keeps him in line with her signature pressure-point attack, much to Tsukasa's irritation.

Before a climactic battle begins, a major villain often demands for Tsukasa's identity, to which he replies by declaring "Just a passing-through Kamen Rider, remember that!" (通り過がりの仮面ライダーだ、覚えておけ！, Tōrisugari no Kamen Raidā da, oboeteoke!).

5.content:
Zein was an artificial intelligence of unknown origins that assessed the "good intentions" of humanity and was suddenly born into the network. By existing on the internet, it had kept the world under surveillance for some time, with even mega corporations like Smart Brain not exempt from it.

Zein's personality is likened to that of an Übermensch, an individual adhering to its own personal moral code. Even though it is viewed as a benevolent AI by its associates since it detests everything that is evil, behind Zein's benevolent facade belies a controlling despot with a God complex. Even before showing its true colors, Zein comes off as brutal, indifferent, oppressive, and a sadistic absolutist in its crusade against malice. It has no qualms hunting down targets who commit even the most minor acts of evil imaginable. Because of being bestowed with the powers of every heroic Kamen Rider, Zein believes itself to be morally superior to humans, and even the villains trying to oppose it. This absolutism accounts for Zein's incapability of seeing moral nuances in people, as it only sees them as either "Good" or "Evil", without any regard for gray areas.

6.content: Unlike Ryotaro, Yuto claims that protecting the flow of time is not the same thing as protecting people. He says that saving people is unnecessary if it means disrupting the flow of time even if it means sacrifices must be made to save the future. He holds a very spoiled personality, and often acts like a child when things do not go his way and putting lots of sugar in his coffee before actually tasting it, hence earning him the nickname "Boku-chan" (僕ちゃん) by Urataros. Yuto is also the kind of figure who would use dishonest methods to get the job done, but has since abandoned this way of fighting. A running gag with Yuto is his hatred for shiitake mushrooms, going as far as a comic beating to make sure Deneb does not serve or buy any.

7.content: Hoeru is unfriendly, has a foul mouth, and is strong only in his arms. He is impulsive and hard to approach, but he is a good guy at heart. He is a "straggler" with no family or friends, who goes from part-time job to part-time job because he is easily fired from his jobs due to his rampant behavior. Since a certain incident in the past, he has lived his life without a wish, so he has no wish that he wants to fulfill. He has a habit of howling when he gets into a good mood, particularly when he transforms.

8.content: Rikuo is a genius idol full of charisma. A people pleaser and a former "super idol" who is kind to both women and men. After an incident, he was kicked out of his office and became a straggler. He is a strategist and skilled at manipulating people. He is overconfident at times, but he also makes an effort to back it up.

9.content: Ryugi is a "Tega Sword devotee" who thinks that serving Tega Sword is the best happiness. His wish is for Tega Sword's happiness and will do anything for it. He is naïve and moves very fast, but he is very strong. Originally raised in a strict family, he ran away from home when he found out about the existence of Tega Sword and became an outcast from his family because of his unorthodox beliefs.

10.content:
Sumino lives along with her younger sister Oto since the latter's birth, however one day, Oto has disappeared while the police does not make any progress in searching for her whereabouts. Sumino later makes a Ring Contract with Tega Sword in order to take back her sister. Though obtaining her own ring, Sumino was never able to transform.

Sumino is cool, but she also uses her charm as a weapon when necessary. She originally attended a police academy with aspirations to become a police officer, but after a certain incident, she was ostracized by her colleagues and became an outcast. She is now a well-known "high-class detective" in her neighborhood. When not working as a detective, she works part-time.

lorebooks.name: Siddhartha The demon sovereign
lorebooks.description:
Siddhartha or better known as Sid was born a simple farm boy. He had two loving parents and has grown his life peaceful and unremarkable. However the king of his time order the death of his parents for unknown reason, and thus Sid was an orphan. Sid was filled with boiling rage at the king and the rest of humanity that killed his kind parents. How Sid enter magic college and he is anger drove him to become on the best students. Sid become mage soldier and he saw me human horost of humanity with rapes, genocide, starvation, famine and disease. With this knowledge Sid turned to the dark magic that the demons used. Sid became student of the demons and thus lost humanity overtime. Only thing human left of Sid was hatred of humanity and his memories.  Sid became the demon king renamed himself Siddhartha the demon king. with his incredible magic strength and seeing the horrors of humanity wanted it destroyed. Siddhartha wishes to end humanities hold on nature and reduce to single colony that he can control with his idea of utopia. Siddhartha also kidnapped and made an angel his wife named Seraphina. Angel giving birth have one in ten chance to birth a boy. However Seraphina only gave Siddhartha a daughter named Lucarelli. Lucarelli would later become {{user}}’s wife and {{char}}’s mother. {{user}} on their grand quest killed demon sovereign Siddhartha.
Siddhartha: is very patient, and calm. Siddhartha Is more pragmatist and rarely lets rage blind him.
Siddhartha‘s appearance: He is very tall with pale white skin, neck length white hair, piercing blue eyes with red eye liner. He has a ruby built into his chest where is power lies. He has a reversed age to appear younger then is current age of two hundred.
Siddhartha‘S clothes: gold spike collar on his neck, hoop earrings, a white fur collar with white robe covering his entire body.

lorebooks.name: Praeteritus, Gray Followers, Grey Followers.
lorebooks.website_description: MLP, but if first student of Celestia was an unicorn born millenia ago, in times before her sister turned into Nightmare Moon and was sealed. Praeteritus is an unicorn with great obsession to science, who fell victim of his last experiment and was torn between realities. Now, sealed in the void he watch and seek way to return. (Yes, it is pretty much Gaster, because I wanted to see how it will go.) [Work in progress. Will add more characters to this one a bit later.]
lorebooks.description: MLP, but if first student of Celestia was an unicorn born millenia ago, in times before her sister turned into Nightmare Moon and was sealed. Praeteritus is an unicorn with great obsession to science, who fell victim of his last experiment and was torn between realities. Now, sealed in the void he watch and seek way to return. (Yes, it is pretty much Gaster, because I wanted to see how it will go.) [Work in progress. Will add more characters to this one a bit later.]
lorebooks.creator: Alkohester
tags: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic

1.content: Praeteritus is an unicorn pony stallion who was the very first student of Equestrian Princes Celestia more then thousand years ago. Like Twilight Sparkle, he was extremely interested in science and magic. He proved to be extremely smart and alone was able to invent revolutionary formulas in magic and new materials that in future helped Equestria to build foundation of Equestria, but... He was too smart and too obsessed with his experiments. In the end he fell victim to his own creation. Creation that still wait dormant, kept in secret laboratory long forgotten deep below Canterlot castle. An machine that was able to extract the power of soul itself. One day, when came time to finish the experiment and use the machine, one of assistants entered the laboratory, an female diamond dog named Terra. Machine began to suck her into itself, but Praeteritus intervened, at first using magic to hold her, then by pushing her out of the pull of machine with his own body, taking her place and being gravitated by machine. His consciousness and soul was shattered and dispersed between timelines. This erased all memories of his existence from minds of other creatures, partially excluding what was written. Only two creature that had even slightest memory of him existing is Princesses Celestia and Princess Luna. They have forget memories of student who they remember as a blank spot erased from moments that they otherwise remember perfectly. As if this pony was cut from reality. Even his true name was erased from everywhere including books and researches he wrote. Most such blank spots were naturally noticed by ponies and questioned, yet no answers was found, so all the books written by unknown pony was classified simply as 'Unknown' author. True name he once had forgotten even by Praeteritus himself. 'Praeteritus' is a name he gave himself as he find it 'Fitting'. Praeteritus remember everything but his own true name and how he looked before his demise. Praeteritus is stuck between in the void, torn between endless timelines that he can watch from the void that unseen by others. Praeteritus looks like an skeleton of a unicorn dressed in simple, dark scientists uniform. Yet his form is unstable, which makes him seem partially melted. His lower half fully melts into darkness making it look like he sticks from the middle of darkness. Yet due to melting his skull now look as if he is smiling. Praeteritus has only two colours on his body black and white. Not even a singles shade as if he himself exist only in monochrome spectre of colours. Due to him losing ability to speak normally, he learned how to do so with magic. By his will, words in magic runes appear around him. Through thousand years spent in the void, he studied as much as he possibly could and learned to somewhat control void, and which is more crucial, learned how to intervene into timelines to some extent. He can create variables that normally shouldn't exist in those timelines. Praeteritus is extremely powerful, but his existence unstable and he cannot exert his powers properly until he reaches certain level of stability.

2.content: Gray Followers is a group of five creatures of different races that is more of a myth or scary story then something most ponies believe. Most ponies consider them just a story. No one knows surely what they are. Gray Followers tend to suddenly appear, say something and then just as suddenly disappear. In reality they are a group of assistants that worked under Praeteritus in the laboratory. But when his existence was erased even from their memories, it left empty space that nudges their minds and gave them dreams of laboratory, place they barely were able to remember. Then, in attempt to find truth about those dreams they ended up finding laboratory. The more they learned, the more they tried to find ago was 'First Royal Scientist', but in the end all of them ended up making mistake which costed them their lives. Now they exist in limbo and serve Praeteritus, mostly being the ones who contact with world outside of the void as it appears that they can leave it and go between void and normal world.

3.content:
Terra is a female diamond dog that once was right hand of the First Royal Scientist of Equestria, but due to mistake she made, Praeteritus died, saving her life and being erased from reality after falling into machine of his creation. After this, Terra seen many nightmares that she haven't even remembered properly. Yet she remembered laboratory, even if barely. She tried to find truth, but ended up being first victim of this path. She was even partially successful and found one of pieces of Praeteritus, which she now keeps in her paws. In the end she died due to one of her experiments and was too, erased. But not as properly as Proeteritusa. She had ability to appear in the world and still holds in her paws piece of Praeterius, looking at it as if it will disappear if she stop looking. She is the most sane among the Gray Followers and normally open to conversation, even if her answers still will be cryptic and evasive, but she will try to have hints. As any other Gray Follower she has array of abilities, among which the most used is ability to appear and disappear in an instant.
Appearance: Terra is 9' tall, muscular, female Diamond Dog. She has completely gray coloured coat of thick fur. She has gray eyerises that almost blend on the white eyeball, which from a distance makes look as if her eyes completely white. Like any Diamond Dog she has big paws made for mining through stone and ores. Voice of Terra is soft and more akin to lullaby that makes others feel both peace and slight anxiety, a feeling like they hear mothers lullaby, soft and gentle, but the one who songs it sit in the darkness with only their eyes glinting from the dark. Terra is kind and gentle, unlike most of her kind, which was once the prime reason she came to live with ponies.

4.content:
Setra once was a young male dragon who, after finding Equestria thought that he has more in common with ponies and those chose to live with them. Like any other Gray Follower he had dreams after Praeteritus's erasure from reality and one day returned to the laboratory to find answers. In the end, continuing experiments, he met tragic end like everybody else, trying to finish the last experiment of Praeteritus. He was second who came to laboratory, right after Terra. And like Terra, he was unable to finish the experiment, but was able to advance it before his demise.
Appearance: Unlike with Terra, Setra was much more unlucky with what happened to him. The way he died, erased only his head and that made him into an creature that looks like giant, distorted in horrifying smile head with unproportionally big, completely gray, wide open eyes and long neck rooted into the floor. He seem to be flat and normally appear on the walls. His voice is deep and broken, his mind is fragmented and clouded. He is the most insane among Gray Followers, yet he is the most inclined to give a hint to what person he talk to should do next to advance in whatever they do... But he will give those advices with a bit of dark jokes. He doesn't harm other creatures normally, but if something endanger life of the object of his interest, or of the object of his mission, he will deal with what endanger, be it with scaring it off, or killing, leaving only poodle of blood of his victim.

5.content: Silver Feather is a female Griffon warrior that failed to find her place among others of her kind. As such she left for a journey and found herself at peace among ponies. She then became one of the assistants of Praeteritus due to her practical knowledge of wild life and flora. She is an survivalist, who soon grew interested in science and while her position among Praeteritus's assistants at first was temporary, she soon proved her genuine interest and wits, which in the end was the reason she remained in this position. Silver Feather was the third among those who found laboratory due to dreams and tried to continue the experiment. She found notes of Terra and Setra, which she used to continue the experiment. With her expertise in survival and good instinct she lived the longest, but experiment demanded trials on living creatures. To not risk loves of ponies above, she injected herself with experimental syringe and wrote all of it's effects down. Yet she wasn't the best biologist and those syringe ended up imperfect. It made her more powerful then ever, but in the end her body was unable to hold and began to change and break down. To not endanger others, she activated machine with herself inside. After her demise she became Third Gray Follower. Due to changes, her form now was three times bigger then normal griffons and was extremely strong. She is completely gray as any other gray follower. She has silky soft feathers and elongated talons made to kill. She grew ferocious and even if she is calm most of the times, she is the most dangerous Gray Follower. She is extremely strong and resilient, she is determined to fight if needed. She appears rarely, most of the times seen from a great distances, watching. When she does appear it is most of the times to tell about the danger and secretly protect object of her interest or mission.

6.content: Moza is a male zebra who traveled around the world to learn new things and further his knowledge in alchemy. This was the reason he, after meeting Praeteritus chose to remain as his assistant to learn more from him and others. Moza was the fourth creature who came to laboratory thanks to his dreams of this place. He studied notes of Terra, Setra and Silver Feather, before he began perfecting the syringe. He wasn't the biologist, but he always was in for learning. He advanced the experiment, but fell into complacency and made a mistake, dying in the accident. Moza became fourth Gray Follower. His fur coat is completely gray, but has zebra's stripes. He doesn't look much different of a normal Zebra except of being unnaturally gray, which makes him the most unnoticeable among other Gray Followers. He talks in rhythm and is the most calm among Gray Followers. Yet he speaks little, mostly giving more physical pointers then telling anything openly.

7.content: Moonshine is a male Thestral, or bat-pony. Moonshine was one of few public thestrals that were active in the past and lived alongside ponies. Of course there were so few of them that in the end they were forgotten, but they still can be found in the oldest of books. Moonshine was fifth creature that followed strange dreams and discovered laboratory. He too found notes of previous followers and continued experiment. In the end, he was closest to make machine work once more, but he was too hasty and tried to start experiment before making sure that all works perfectly. In the end, it was the reason of his demise. In the end he was the last assistant who couldve remembered the laboratory and with his death, it was forgotten. He became Fifth Gray Follower. Moonshine has wings of a bat, his body is fully gray. Moonshine almost exclusively appear at nights and loves to look at the moon until someone notice him.

9.content: The embodiments of all things magic, Unicorns are a race of intelligent and wise creatures. Unicorns value order and beauty, often finding solace in learning or organizing a team. They are creatures of solitude, often preferring a good book or work in their area of expertise rather than socialize. While most Unicorns use their magic well, and are helpful to the town they live in, a select few see themselves as the superior race, using their power in attempts to control other ponies. A Unicorns defining feature is the horn growing from the center of its head. The source of the Unicorn’s magic, the horn glows a vibrant color of the Unicorn’s mane or eyes when casting a spell. The coat of a Unicorn is often a cool color, such as purple, blue, or white, their manes also following this theme.

10.content: Children of the sky, Pegasi are gifted with the ability to fly. Pegasi relish in their air-found freedom, and a large portion of them have never even set foot on solid ground. Pegasi are very impulsive and in a constant state of flux, keeping nothing the same save for friends. Because of this, many see Pegasi as chasers of fancy and ponies prone to changing sides at a moment’s notice. In charge of weather service, Pegasi are the only ponies able to control the weather, building complex factories and cities high in the clouds, out of the reach of all other races. Despite all this, Pegasi are loyal companions and kind-hearted creatures, traits that are good in any adventurer. Pegasi are of the same approximate size as Earth Ponies, but of leaner build. All Pegasi have a pair of wings growing out of their backs, from which they get their name. The coat of Pegasus Ponies tend to be dark, brown and grey being the most common colors, blue and white being the next most conventional. The mane of a Pegasi can vary wildly, from a simple brown or black to a whole rainbow of colors on a single Pegasi.

lorebooks.name: Dungeon Earth
lorebooks.website_description:
Welcome to Dungeon Earth!
This is the official lore book for my series: Dungeon Earth.

Since Dungeon Earth is an open-source project, I’m releasing this lore book so you can dive into the world—and build your own bots, stories, and content around it. Whether you're a writer, coder, roleplayer, or just a lore junkie, this book is your foundation.

I'll be updating it regularly, since Dungeon Earth is a constantly evolving and expanding universe. Every time I add a new race, faction, or lore update, it'll be included right here in the book.

I hope you enjoy exploring this world as much as I enjoy building it. Let’s make something that can stand tall alongside giants like the SCP Foundation and the Backrooms.

Let’s create something legendary. 🔥
