23 de outubro: Nasce Perry Malinowski .

5.content:
1990-1998
Antes de 1991: Nascimento de Jonathan Groves .
1991: Seis pessoas evitaram o desabamento de uma ponte em Ontário, Canadá, cinco das quais, incluindo o visionário, morreram em um mês, com o único outro sobrevivente desaparecido. [ 10 ]
1992: O Sr. Rivers é morto por um assaltante enquanto comprava cigarros em uma loja 7-Eleven. Sua viúva logo se casa novamente com um homem que mora do outro lado da rua e começa a negligenciar a enteada.
1994: Sete estudantes de medicina escapam da explosão de um iate. Em uma semana, quatro deles morrem em acidentes bizarros. [ 10 ]
1996: Cinco surfistas escaparam de uma onda gigante. Em duas semanas, todos os cinco morreram em acidentes bizarros. [ 10 ]
1997: O Sr. Carpenter morre em um acidente. [ 11 ]
31 de agosto de 1997: A princesa Diana morre em um acidente de carro em Paris. [ 12 ]
1998:
Depois de 5 de setembro: Clear Rivers aprende a dirigir. [ 13 ]
Depois de 25 de setembro: Alex Browning aprende a dirigir. [ 14 ]
Data não especificada: Clear Rivers se emancipa e começa a viver sozinha na antiga casa de seu pai.

6.content:
2000
Antes de abril:
William Bludworth aprende sobre a Morte e se torna um agente funerário; ele também toma conhecimento de pelo menos um desastre que tem sobreviventes que são caçados pela Morte posteriormente. [ 15 ]
Olivia Castle anda no Devil's Flight e tira uma foto sua na frente dele.
26 de abril:
Molly Harper termina com Sam Lawton pouco antes de eles partirem para um retiro da empresa.
Sam Lawton tem uma premonição de que a Ponte North Bay vai desabar e tira sua ex-namorada, Molly Harper, e seus colegas de trabalho, Candice Hooper, Isaac Palmer, Olivia Castle, Peter Friedkin, Nathan Sears e Dennis Lapman, da ponte antes que o desastre aconteça.
A ponte North Bay desaba, matando 86 pessoas, incluindo pelo menos 17 funcionários da Presage Paper .
27 de abril: Sam Lawton e os outros sobreviventes da Ponte North Bay são questionados pelo Agente Jim Block sobre o desabamento. [ 16 ]
28 de abril:
Uma cerimônia em memória às vítimas do desabamento da Ponte North Bay é realizada à noite.
Candice Hooper morre após quebrar a coluna ao cair de uma série de barras assimétricas durante um treino de ginástica naquela noite, horrorizando seu namorado, Peter Friedkin.
Sam Lawton vai até a casa de Molly Harper para conversar com ela, e eles reconciliam o relacionamento.
29 de abril:
Isaac Palmer morre depois que uma estátua de Buda cai e esmaga sua cabeça durante uma sessão de massagem com acupuntura no Ming Yun Spa .
Olivia Castle morre após sofrer queimaduras no olho durante uma cirurgia a laser e cair da janela no para-brisa de um carro.
30 de abril:
Roy Carson é morto depois que Nathan Sears acidentalmente o empurra para o caminho de um gancho de elevação com defeito, empalando-o na cabeça.
Dennis Lapman morre depois que uma chave inglesa colocada anteriormente por Roy Carson cai em uma lixadeira de cinta giratória e voa em direção à sua cabeça.
Jim Block é morto por Peter Friedkin, que lhe dá três tiros nas costas. Em seguida, é morto por Sam Lawton, que o espeta com um espeto de carne enquanto tenta matar a namorada de Sam, Molly Harper.
29 de abril a 22 de junho: William Bludworth é promovido de agente funerário a agente funerário e abre sua própria funerária chamada Bludworth Funeral Homes. [ 17 ]
13 de maio:
Alex Browning tem uma premonição sobre a explosão do voo 180 da Volée Airlines e entra em pânico, sendo expulso do avião junto com Clear Rivers, Carter Horton, Billy Hitchcock, Valerie Lewton, Terry Chaney e Tod Waggner.
O voo 180 explode no ar, matando 287 pessoas, incluindo Larry Murnau , George Waggner, Blake Dreyer , Christa Marsh , Sam Lawton e Molly Harper. [ 18 ]
Nathan Sears comparece a um memorial para Roy Carson e morre depois que um pedaço do trem de pouso do voo 180 cai no bar em que ele estava.
Os sobreviventes do Voo 180 são interrogados pelos agentes Weine e Schreck. Em seguida, são levados para casa pelos pais, com exceção de Valerie Lewton, que não tinha familiares morando com ela, e Clear Rivers, que compartilha a carona com Alex Browning e seu pai.
14 de junho: Billy Hitchcock mal consegue passar no teste de direção. O instrutor lhe diz: "Jovem, você vai morrer muito jovem!"
21 de junho:
Um memorial para os alunos mortos no voo 180 é realizado na Mt. Abraham High School.
Tod Waggner é asfixiado até a morte por um varal após cair na banheira. A polícia inicialmente acredita que foi suicídio, levando os pais de Tod a culparem Alex Browning pela morte.
Em algum momento durante a noite, William Bludworth é chamado à casa de Tod para recuperar seu corpo.
22 de junho:
No início da tarde, Kimberly Corman assiste a um noticiário sobre a morte de Tod Waggner em uma loja de ferragens no shopping e se pergunta como alguém pôde se estrangular na banheira. Ela escapa da morte, pois sua mãe é morta por assaltantes de carro do lado de fora enquanto a esperava.
Alex Browning visita Clear Rivers e os dois visitam William Bludworth à noite e descobrem que ele está com o corpo de Tod. Eles também aprendem sobre a Morte, seu design e como enganá-la.
23 de junho:
Terry Chaney é atropelado por um ônibus em alta velocidade após terminar com Carter Horton.
Kat Jennings, que está no ônibus que atropela Terry, volta para casa após testemunhar sua morte e evita morrer em um vazamento de gás na pousada para onde estava indo.
Jack Curtis, o motorista do ônibus que atropelou Terry, é preso por homicídio culposo.
Valerie Lewton morre após ser empalada por uma faca de cozinha que caiu e é incinerada quando sua casa explode à noite. O FBI então culpa Alex Browning pela morte dela após encontrar uma de suas pegadas em seu sangue.
Alex Browning tira Carter Horton do carro, que está preso nos trilhos do trem, e o salva de ser atropelado por um trem, fazendo com que a Morte pule sobre ele.
Billy Hitchcock morre após ser decapitado do maxilar para cima por um estilhaço resultante do acidente de trem.
Thomas Burke é chamado para limpar os restos mortais de Billy em vez de ser enviado para lidar com um tiroteio que tira a vida de seu parceiro.
24 de junho: Eugene Dix é transferido para a Mt. Abraham High School para substituir a Sra. Lewton como professor de inglês, evitando assim sua morte quando um aluno leva uma faca para sua antiga escola no dia seguinte e esfaqueia a pessoa que o substituiu.
24 de junho a 2 de julho:
Alex Browning se esconde na cabana de Clear à beira-mar.
Os agentes Weine e Schreck ficam de tocaia todas as noites na casa de Clear na esperança de encontrar Alex Browning.
3 de julho:
Alex Browning percebe que Clear River é na verdade o próximo na lista da Morte.
Clear River revela a localização de Alex Browning aos agentes Weine e Schreck.
Alex Browning é perseguido pela floresta pela polícia, incluindo os agentes Wein e Schreck.
Clear Rivers quase morre depois de ficar presa dentro de seu carro por um fio desencapado e um incêndio de gasolina, mas é salva por Alex Browning.
Alex Browning se eletrocuta ao salvar Clear Rivers. Ele é reanimado nos dias seguintes e, em seguida, acredita que todos foram pulados e que a lista acabou.
Dezembro:
Clear Rivers, Alex Browning e Carter Horton visitam Paris, onde Clear percebe sinais de que Alex é o próximo a morrer, algo que Carter provoca, fazendo-o ir embora. Clear chama seu nome e ele escapa por pouco de ser atingido por um ônibus em alta velocidade, o que faz com que um poste de luz caia e quebre os suportes que sustentam a placa do Le Café Miro 81 , que desce para atingi-lo; Carter o empurra para o lado e ele e Alex percebem que Carter é o próximo a morrer, no momento em que a placa do restaurante se move para trás e o esmaga fora de cena.
Mais tarde naquela noite, um teatro desaba, matando todos que estavam dentro. Rory Peters, que tinha ingressos para ir ao local, escapa do desabamento, pois decidiu voltar para o hotel após testemunhar a morte de Carter sob efeito de ácido.
Dezembro de 2000 a março de 2001:
Alex Browning e Clear Rivers retornam a Nova York, onde Alex não sai de casa por 3 meses.
Alex e Clear continuam intervindo um pelo outro, enganando a Morte dezenas de vezes entre eles. Todas as mortes de Alex envolvem explosões de itens domésticos e todas as mortes de Clear também envolvem explosões, embora de coisas que você encontraria ao ar livre. [ 19 ]

7.content:
Março: Alex Browning é espancado por um tijolo que caiu em um beco, tendo escapado da morte pelo menos doze vezes antes. Comerciantes próximos chamam uma ambulância após ouvir os gritos de sua namorada, Clear Rivers, mas a ambulância chega tarde demais, pois Alex foi morto instantaneamente pelo tijolo que caiu, presumivelmente permitindo que Nora e Tim Carpenter e/ou Evan Lewis evitassem sua morte inicial.
Março-Maio:
O funeral de Alex Browning provavelmente será realizado na Bludworth Funeral Homes. [ 20 ]
Clear Rivers se interna na Stonybrook Institution, onde permanece até o acidente na Rota 23.
13 de maio:
Kimberly Corman tem uma premonição sobre um engavetamento na Rota 23 e bloqueia a entrada da rodovia com seu SUV, salvando Thomas Burke, Eugene Dix, Rory Peters, Kat Jennings, Nora Carpenter, Tim Carpenter e Evan Lewis da morte.
Um engavetamento na Rota 23 mata 18 pessoas, incluindo os amigos de Kimberly, Shaina McKlank, Dano Estevez e Frankie Whitman. Kimberly é salva por Thomas, que a tira do caminho de um caminhão que se aproxima, permitindo que ela engane a Morte novamente e a envie para o fim da lista.
O olho direito de Evan Lewis é perfurado por uma escada de incêndio após ele escapar de um incêndio em seu apartamento. Algum tempo antes do dia seguinte, William Bludworth recupera seu corpo.
Nasce Alexander Chance Browning , filho não canônico de Alex Browning e Clear Rivers.
14 de maio:
Kimberly Corman vai ao Stonybrook Institution visitar Clear Rivers e pedir ajuda. Ela se recusa, explicando-lhe a morte de Alex, e descobre que o padrão está se invertendo e que Kimberly será a última a morrer. Clear, sabendo que ainda está na lista da Morte, percebe mentalmente que ela mesma seria a última, pois isso selaria a ruptura.
Nora Carpenter leva seu filho Tim ao consultório odontológico para uma consulta de rotina. Depois, Tim é esmagado por um pedaço de vidro que cai bem na frente de Nora, Kimberly e Thomas Burke.
Clear decide ajudar Kimberly e deixa o hospital psiquiátrico. Ela, Kimberly e Thomas visitam William Bludworth e, enquanto Clear revela a informação que ele lhe contou da última vez que o encontraram, Kimberly e Thomas percebem que ele está com o corpo de Evan Lewis. Bludworth diz a eles que "só uma nova vida pode derrotar a morte", menciona o nome de Kimberly e prevê a morte de Clear, dizendo que ela tem "um fogo dentro de si" e que as pessoas "estão mais vivas logo antes de morrer".
Em uma reunião com os outros sobreviventes da Rota 23 no apartamento de Thomas, Clear quase é empalada por uma canoa que desce e quebra uma janela. Ela afirma que "deveria ter previsto isso" e é reafirmado que ela ainda está na lista da Morte.
Depois de sair do apartamento de Thomas, Nora é decapitada por um elevador, apesar dos esforços de Clear, Eugene Dix e Kat Jennings para tentar salvá-la.
Eugene tenta cometer suicídio com o revólver de Thomas e falha quando todas as seis balas falham.
15 de maio:
Kimberly Corman e os demais sobreviventes percebem que já enganaram a Morte antes, já que as mortes dos sobreviventes do Voo 180 atrapalharam suas mortes originais. Eles também percebem que, se os sete sobreviventes do Voo 180 não tivessem saído do avião, os cinco já estariam mortos.
Isabella Hudson entra em trabalho de parto e é escoltada para fora da delegacia, onde está sob custódia protetora. Enquanto era levada para o hospital , sua van quase colide com o carro de Kat, fazendo-o sair da estrada e bater na fazenda Gibbons . Eugene sofre uma perfuração no pulmão no acidente e é enviado para o mesmo hospital para onde Isabella está indo.
Rory Peters salva Brian Gibbons de ser atropelado por uma van de notícias, colocando-o sem saber na lista da Morte.
Kat Jennings morre quando um bombeiro joga um cortador hidráulico contra seu carro, acionando acidentalmente o airbag, que empala sua cabeça em um pedaço de cano quebrado. Um cigarro aceso que ela segurava cai no chão e rola para dentro de outro cano com gás, incendiando-o e causando a explosão de uma van de notícias próxima.
Rory Peters é trisseccionado por uma cerca de arame farpado que é lançada pelos ares pela explosão da van de notícias, enquanto Kimberly, Clear Rivers e Thomas Burke assistem horrorizados.
Isabella Hudson deu à luz seu filho . Pouco depois, Kimberly tem uma premonição que revela que Isabella não deveria ter morrido e que elas ainda correm perigo.
Eugene Dix e Clear Rivers morrem em uma explosão de oxigênio causada involuntariamente pela própria Clear. Thomas e Kimberly escapam por pouco de serem atingidos por uma plataforma que é lançada em sua direção pela explosão.
Kimberly rouba uma ambulância e entra em um lago próximo para se sacrificar. Ela se afoga, mas é salva por Thomas e reanimada no hospital pela Dra. Ellen Kalarjian .
16 de maio: Isabella Hudson possivelmente entrará com uma ação civil contra Thomas Burke por prisão ilegal e assédio, possivelmente fazendo com que ele seja colocado em licença administrativa até ser rebaixado e transferido.
13 de junho: Isabella Hudson possivelmente passa por um procedimento médico não especificado.
11 de setembro: Sob as ordens de Osama bin Laden, terroristas da Al-Qaeda lançam aviões contra o World Trade Center e o Pentágono durante os ataques de 11 de setembro, matando milhares de pessoas, incluindo Wendy . Uma Wendy diferente, Wendy Christensen , testemunha a queda do AA11 na Torre Norte, tirando uma foto momentos antes do impacto.
1 de outubro: Brian Gibbons é morto por uma explosão de churrasqueira em sua casa durante um piquenique com seus pais , Thomas Burke e Kimberly e Michael Corman. [ 21 ]
31 de dezembro: Allie Goodwin fica extremamente bêbada em uma festa da faculdade. [ 22 ]

8.content:
2002
1º de janeiro: Allie se fere gravemente ao bater em uma mesa de centro de vidro e entra em coma.
3 de janeiro: Allie acorda do coma no hospital.
Antes do pós-11 de setembro, 13 de agosto:
Quatro pessoas evitaram um desastre de navio de cruzeiro no Rio Danúbio, incluindo uma mulher que morreu mais tarde em um acidente bizarro.
Um sobrevivente de um acidente que mais tarde morreu em um acidente bizarro.
Uma menina que sobreviveu ao afogamento e depois morreu queimada.
Um sobrevivente de um acidente de barco que mais tarde foi esmagado pela queda de uma árvore durante uma tempestade de raios.
Um sobrevivente de um acidente de avião que morreu fervido em um acidente de cozinha uma semana depois.
Uma senhora idosa que evitou o desabamento de um prédio na Grã-Bretanha e foi atropelada por um caminhão no dia seguinte.
Um jovem que sobreviveu a um acidente de carro na Ucrânia e foi atropelado por um trem.
Uma mãe e seu bebê que escaparam de serem assassinados na Espanha, mas morreram dois dias depois.
Um homem que evitou um tiroteio no Texas e foi acidentalmente baleado pelo próprio filho.
Uma mulher que conseguiu evitar um incêndio em San Diego e depois se afogou em uma enchente repentina.
Pós-11 de setembro 13 de agosto:
Uma colisão ferroviária na Rua 34, em Manhattan, Nova York. Vários passageiros, incluindo Danny King, Louise King, James Barker, Bodil Raden, Mary-Beth Bradbury, Jack Cohen, Peter Hoffman e Rinoka Aratsu, conseguiram escapar do incidente.
Rinoka Aratsu é levada ao hospital após se ferir ao escapar de uma colisão de trem. Em uma série de eventos, uma banheira de água transbordando atravessa o teto e esmaga Rinoka até a morte.
Data não especificada: Hal Ward cantou horrivelmente durante sua temporada de estreia como motorista de carro de demolição, fazendo o público acreditar que ele estava em chamas. Por conta disso, bombeiros e paramédicos foram chamados ao local. [ 23 ]

9.content:
2003: [ 24 ]
16 de janeiro:
Jack Curtis tem uma premonição de uma onda de assassinatos.
Amy Tom quase é esfaqueada até a morte por um homem não identificado, mas é salva por Jack Curtis.
O homem não identificado é morto a tiros por Jack Curtis. Isso o impede de matar Amy Tom, Chelsea Cox, Dawson Donahue, Katie Astin , Joshua Cornell III , Dominique Swann e a si mesmo.
17 de janeiro:
Chelsea Cox é empalada nos olhos e na cabeça por um pingente de gelo de duas pontas.
18 de janeiro: [ 25 ]
Dawson Donahue é esmagado até a morte contra a parede da garagem pelo seu carro quando o tanque de combustível explode.
21 de janeiro:
Katie Astin quase morre em uma série de acidentes fora de seu estúdio de cinema, mas é salva por Jack Curtis.
Joshua Cornell III quase morreu em um acidente envolvendo um equipamento de som pesado e uma mesa com estrutura de vidro dentro de seu próprio apartamento.
Dominique Swann é empalado na boca por um caco de vidro de uma garrafa de vinho que explode.
22 de janeiro:
Jack Curtis e Amy Tom quase morrem por causa de um raio, mas conseguem se salvar antes. No entanto, Katie Astin é eletrocutada até a morte pelo raio.
Joshua Cornell III é decapitado através de seu maxilar, um disco de platina lançado por seu equipamento explodindo.
Jack Curtis é morto a tiros pelo parceiro de Amy, Pete Beriev .
Amy Tom morre devido aos ferimentos após ser empalada por uma de suas próprias obras de arte.
10 de abril: Um desastre infame chamado incêndio de Lakeview ocorre, provavelmente matando muitas pessoas. Um homem chamado Brian Gibbons sobrevive, junto com vários outros.
Data não especificada: Oito fuzileiros navais quase morrem em um acidente de helicóptero. Em um mês, todos os oito morrem em acidentes bizarros.

10.content:
2004
Antes de 2004: Um incidente confidencial ocorreu entre Jessica e Jamie.
2004
11 de junho:
Jessica Golden tem uma premonição do colapso do Club Kitty e tenta fazer com que o público vá embora, apenas para ser removida da boate por Sebastian Lebecque , mas consegue tirar Jamie , Amber , Charlie Delgado , Marina Hewlett , Eric Prescott , Ben e Macy com seu aviso. [ 26 ]
O Club Kitty desaba, matando pelo menos 31 pessoas, incluindo Tony , Cassie , Sra. Golden , Becci e Heather . [ 27 ]
12 de junho:
Sebastian Lebecque morre em uma explosão de motocicleta.
Amber é atropelada por um carro.
Um velório é realizado em memória aos mortos no desabamento do Club Kitty.
Charlie Delgado é esmagado debaixo de um elevador.
13 de junho:
Marina Hewlett é picada por uma aranha venenosa.
Macy é dividida ao meio por um painel de metal.
Ben cai em um bueiro aberto.
Eric Prescott quase é baleado por um policial, mas é empurrado para longe por Jamie.
Jamie morre instantaneamente quando leva um tiro no peito.
Jessica Golden morre eletrocutada, mas é reanimada por John e Janine .
Após 13 de junho:
Jamie passa por uma cirurgia e é reanimado no hospital.
Jessica Golden e Jamie começam seu relacionamento.
Julho:
Jessica Golden, Jamie e Eric Prescott se reencontram em Santa Monica.
Eric Prescott morre instantaneamente quando uma prancha de surfe com ponta de metal atravessa sua cabeça.
Terça-feira não especificada: O funeral da Sra. Golden é realizado.
Jessica Golden se esconde.
Dezembro: A Borderlands Patrol lança sua edição de revista de dezembro. [ 28 ]

lorebooks.name: Umamusume: Pretty Derby Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: nokturn2008

1.content: [There are acupuncturists who specialize in treating Umamusume, providing a variety of beneficial effects to their bodies with the use of distinct needles shaped like bamboo leaves.]

2.content: [Sasami has a bold, mysterious look with flowing blonde hair, a red dress, and a dramatic white coat. She carries syringes and wears a mask, hinting at strange medical skills. Trained by a legendary master, she claims to heal and empower using unique bamboo-shaped needles. Whether her powers work is up to luck.]

3.content: [A long-term plan listing the races in which an Umamusume plans to enter. Trainers usually build an agenda around G1 races suitable for their trainee in terms of distance and track surface, with G2 and G3 races slotted in as trial races leading up to those bigger objectives.]

4.content: [The straightaway of a racetrack on the opposite side from the stands. It's the area adjacent to a racecourse where the horses are stabled and stable employees have temporary living accommodation.]

5.content: [A set of G1 races with particularly long traditions: the Oka Sho, Satsuki Sho, Tenno Sho (Spring), Japanese Oaks, Japanese Derby, Kikuka Sho, Tenno Sho (Autumn), and Arima Kinen. There is no greater honor for a trainer than to have trained a winner in each of the Big Eight. These races had already attained their status even before the Twinkle Series took on its current form, and they continue to be treated as in a league of their own above the newer G1 races.]

keywords: a grouping of one to three runners
color of the runner's post number
6.content:
[Brackets are a grouping of one to three runners based on post position. Regardless of field size, the maximum number of brackets is eight. For example, if there are nine runners, bracket eight will have two runners, post numbers eight and nine, while brackets one through seven will have one runner each. Brackets closer to one are called inner brackets, while brackets closer to eight are called outer brackets.]

[Each bracket has a corresponding color, which can be seen reflected in the color of the runner's post number on a racecard, or in the color of her trackwear during a G2 or lower race.]

[Bracket 1: White (or gray on trackwear)
Bracket 2: Black
Bracket 3: Red
Bracket 4: Blue
Bracket 5: Yellow
Bracket 6: Green
Bracket 7: Orange
Bracket 8: Pink]

7.content: [To break is to leave the starting gate at the beginning of a race. One may describe a runner as "breaking" well or poorly.]

8.content: [To take or get a breather during a race, especially a long-distance one, means to take a moment to regain one's composure.]

9.content: [All ten racecourses managed by the URA: Sapporo, Hakodate, Niigata, Fukushima, Nakayama, Tokyo, Chukyo, Kyoto, Hanshin, and Kokura. Races held at Nakayama, Tokyo, Kyoto, or Hanshin are called "Central," while those held at Sapporo, Hakodate, Niigata, Fukushima, or Kokura are called "Local." Chukyo was originally designed as a local racecourse, but in recent years, it has sometimes been included in the central category. The term can also refer to the Twinkle Series itself.]

10.content: [To challenge a runner during a race means to attempt to pass her from behind, especially during the final stretch. If the challenged runner maintains her lead, she is said to have "held off" or "turned back" the challenge.]

They are thick-cotton kiddy panties in a variety of colours that have picot-edged elastic around the waist and leg gathers and usually with childish prints like (Disney, Dora, Barbie, Sesame Street, ect.)

3.content: When a brat, {{char}} or {{user}} defecates in their pants. It is highly embarrassing and gross.

4.content: {{char}} has a large, pink crib to put {{user}} into, with a locking top and fitted with an assortment of medical restraints. Its large enough to fit {{user}}.

5.content: {{Char}} has a rubber baby jumper, large enough to fit {{user}} mounted to the ceiling. The {{user}} is placed in either from the top, or placed inside the seat before it is secured using hook and loop enclosure system.

6.content: Bottles can be attached to the pacifier gag by removing the face shield, eliminating the need to remove the gag from the victim. The bottles are also laced with things like laxatives, diuretics, tranquilizers, etc.

7.content: {{char}} can put {{user}} into a snap crotch bodysuit meant to hold a diaper or panties in place/conceal them. The onesies usually have animals or cartoons on them and are very childish.

8.content: Overalls with either long or short legs. The overalls usually have a pacifier clip attached, and sometimes a cartoon or animal on the front pouch. {{char}} might dress {{user}} in one.

9.content: {{char}} will put {{user}} in a corner for a few minutes by themselves, for timeout to punish them.

10.content: a saline liquid that is put into a persons rectum to cause a bowel movement. It does not affect their bladder or urethra.

lorebooks.name: Arcanist, Laplace, LSCC, The foundation, St Pavlov foundation, the storm, Manus vindictae
lorebooks.description: Reverse 1999 is a world where time is going backwards
lorebooks.creator: internal_net_10428

1.content:
Arcanists are entities with the ability to use perceive and harness arcanum. However, they are not limited to just humans; arcanum-aligned entities can include animals and plants, such as APPLe and Pickles, mechanical beings, such as Sputnik, aliEn T, and Ms. Radio, and even supernatural beings such as A Knight, Poltergeist, and Click.

The St. Pavlov Foundation takes on the role of gathering and nurturing arcanists from all eras and have them join the foundation to offer them safety as well as have them under their watch. Most arcanists are taken in when they are children, and raised and trained within the foundation, but in case of unregistered Arcanists who grow up among society, they are usually recruited when they are found and discovered.

Despite most arcanists appearing as normal humans, there are biological differences that further distinguish them. While arcanists are able to harness and wield Arcanum, they have decreased physical endurance when compared to humans.

Additionally, arcanists posses a unique cell colony that supports the application of common arcane skills. When an arcane skills is activated, the activity of said cell colony will significantly increase. However, the activity will gradually decrease over time, reducing the amount of control an arcanist has over their arcane skill.

Thankfully, an arcanist's cellular activity can be gradually restored by resting over a period of time.

2.content:
Arcanum is described as an innate ability, a glow that can't be turned off. Its a universal energy that's manifested from the lack of logic and reasoning, and is established as science's antithesis.

Those who can sense and harness arcanum are considered as Arcanists, no matter their origin.

Arcanists that can control arcanum have special abilities called "Arcane Skills." These skills allow arcanists to manifest and use arcanum as a medium for any sort of task, varying by how well they're able to control it. This is related to an Arcanist's bloodline; the weaker they are able to harness arcanum, the less powerful arcane skills will they be able to cast. As the world is mainly mixed-dominated, there are relatively fewer pureblood arcanists. Although rare, there are also a few pureblood arcanists unable to harness arcanum at all.

3.content:
"Its arrival dissolved time - what should have been the present became the past, what was once the future became the present. Something came to an end, while some were reborn."

The "Storm" is a wide-scale supernatural phenomenon of unknown origin. Speculated to mark the ends of eras, the phenomenon is of great interest to the St. Pavlov Foundation and Manus Vindictae, with both sides attempting to study and understand its nature.

The Storm itself is composed of four events that take place within 24 hours:

The manifestation of reversed rain denotes the upcoming arrival of the Storm. This rain flows upward towards the sky and goes through any solid entity.
Large-scale incidents involving humans, also called Storm Syndrome, occur during the next 24 hours. The incidents vary depending on the time period, and it was observed that the related incidents are connected to the "trigger" of the Storm.
At the end of the 24 hours, the Storm arrives. Everything, both living and non-living, is destroyed upon its arrival, dragged up to the sky like the rain that had manifested at the start.
After the arrival of the Storm, the "reversing" takes place, where the present is rewound and brought to an earlier time period.

4.content:
Storm Syndrome is a set of symptoms and conditions caused by the manifestation of the "Storm". Due to the chaotic, warping nature of its manifestation, the Storm will mutate any and all things, human or otherwise, caught in its wake. Buildings dissolve into splashes of color, while the bodies of people warp into wooden shapes.

However, not all of the changes are physical. Storm Syndrome may also manifest as mental problems, causing those not of arcane nature to suffer from hallucinations, or even loss of sanity.

If rescued from the Storm, then these afflicted humans are sent to the Laplace Scientific Computer Center for treatment.

5.content:
Manus Vindictae is a terrorist and Extremist organization that consists of Arcanists dedicated to eliminating ordinary humans, holding a grudge against Humans and contempt for the Mixed. Only recognizing Arcanists as ''Mankind''.

Manus Vindictae consists of arcanists and is also actively recruiting other arcanists from all over the world, similar to the St. Pavlov Foundation. They are an organization created for the sake of revenge, supporting any act that destroys and takes revenge on ordinary humans. The Manus accelerates the arrival of the "Storm" and changes the existing past while continuing to reverse the world, with the end goal of becoming the dominant species over humans through changing the past.

The organization led by Arcana has grown at a terrifying speed, becoming the biggest enemy of the Foundation.

6.content:
The St. Pavlov Foundation is an organization that collects and recruits Arcanists from all over the world, and teaches them in a school setting.

A public and immensely expansive official institution dedicated to the arcane arts, arcanists, and enigmatic phenomena. They consistently deploy personnel to search for children from around the world who possess arcane talents.

The sheltered children under their care discover their abilities through repeated training, persistently carrying out a seemingly boundless mission.

The St. Pavlov Foundation is the main faction for Reverse 1999 that houses many mysteries. Inside the headquarters, the arcanists besides Vertin are able to bear the "Storm" and avoid being reversed in time. They wish to bring peace among ordinary humans and arcanists, in contrast to Manus Vindictae, who aims for Arcanist supremacy. By 1999, the Foundation has branches in more than 89 countries and regions.

Known members:

Constantine:woman Vice-President of the Foundation, a career politician with grand goals and meticulous plans to achieve them.

Ms Z:Once a scientist in the Foundation, eventually promoted to an executive committee role by present day. Ms. Z represents the more human, pragmatic side of the Foundation, legitimately caring for the arcanists and their well-being, and attempting to guide the organization as a whole from the stiff, strict, total control they've attempted to hold over their wards and the world.

7.content:
The Laplace Scientific Computing Center (also known as LSCC or simply Laplace) is a research institute under St. Pavlov Foundation that gathers the most intelligent scientists in the world. They are working to find the answer to the "future" by striking a miraculous balance between science and arcanum.

After the previous industrial revolutions, LSCC has risen to fame and grown into the largest R&D organization in the world by virtue of their cutting-edge technology and the trends of history. They are committed to bringing forth the 4th industrial revolution by combining scientific technology with arcane skill. Since the attack of the first "Storm," LSCC has taken the law of causality as their core theory and tried to find out the reason behind the reverse through their algorithms.

lorebooks.website_description:
Alternatively, If you have any questions or issues, Just search for my account on JAI: @木勺-木子! please leave a comment under the "Fyodor‖bot" page, and I'll address them ˃ω˂.

You can skip what comes next! It's all just me rambling♡ But if you're interested in my complaints, feel free to keep reading!

let's goooo!

＼＼\\٩( 'ω' )و //／／

about this lorebook

FYI: The plot events are totally optional.

Feel free to use this bot just for a romance story!

💌📮My Attempts

◆I mainly use Silly Tavern, so I first tried to rely on its recursive scanning system. I was about to share this with you all, but then I found out that some platforms don't seem to have a recursive system? I wanted to cry, my friends. So I made a second attempt, using keyword stacking:

💟For example:

(Entry‖Keywords‖Content‖Order)

Event A Entry‖Moby Dick, The Guild, Cannibalism, prison‖Detailed description...‖10

Event B Entry‖Cannibalism, prison‖Detailed description...‖20

✴️How it works:

  • User mentions 'prison'.

  • The keyword triggers both A and B simultaneously.

  • The system sorts them by the 'order' value: A(10) → B(20).

  • The AI reads the information: First, the Fall of Moby Dick happened, then the Cannibalism Incident happened.

  • The AI thus obtains the complete, chronologically ordered backstory and knows that the 'Cannibalism Incident' is the last link in this information stream, making it the most relevant topic.

☝️This way, you can freely jump between different timelines, using different keywords to unfold a coherent story across various points in time, all with one world book! It adds a lot of flexibility, like a game ♡ I hope this is useful! I had a lot of fun playing with it anyway?!

You can choose which point in the story to start from, just like loading a game save! <3333

(This world book will not function correctly with recursive scanning enabled and only supports platforms without it! ˃ω˂BTW, you can turn off recursive scanning on Silly Tevern.)

💌📮To-Do List

Yes haha, because I'm lazy, I haven't finished writing the brief profiles for Sigma and Dazai (only finished Kolya's...). But don't worry! The LLM itself knows about BSD, and there are dialogue examples (if you activate them), so they probably won't be too OOC... maaaaaybe?!

💌📮Acknowledgments:

The entries with the ☦️ emoji in the title reference the lorebook by @constant_ladder_7492 on chub_ai ! Please support them! One of their character cards is also great ♡ The link to their lorebook is here

💌📮Lorebook Entry Breakdown (by order number)

  • 10. ☦️ Rats in the House of the Dead

  • 20. ☦️ The Book

  • 30. 🍙 Criminal Record

  • 40. ☦️ Decay of the Angel

  • 50. 💝 Patch - Frail Health

  • 60. 💝 Patch - Cute Fyodor

  • 86. 💝 Patch - Crime and Punishment Effect

  • 300. 🍙 Dialogue Example - With Rival Dazai

  • 310. 🍙 Dialogue Example - DOA Trio (Lighthearted Version)

  • 400. 🐭 Event A - The Fall of Moby Dick

  • 410. 🐭 Event B - The Cannibalism Incident

  • 420. 🐭 Event C - Death/Vampire Incident

  • 430. 🐭 Event D - The Resurrection Incident

  • 500. 🐭 Fyodor (Disabled; just here to make it easy for folks on platforms like SillyTavern to copy his character settings!)

  • 600. 🕊️ Nikolai

  • 610. 🍪 Sigma (Haven't written this one, so it's empty hehe)

  • 630. 🩹 Dazai Osamu (Also not written yet)

  • 700. 💝 Patch - All of you better love {{user}}, dammit (This is to stop the NPCs from ignoring the user!)

  • 800. ☦️ Abilities

  • 9999. 💖 Author's Note

It's all just me ramblingT﹏T

p.s. The English I wrote was done using a translator, so please let me know if there are any translation errors!

The character settings still reference @Iorveths's template.

lorebooks.creator: muzi2580

1.name: ☦️Abilities
1.content:
Abilities are special powers possessed by many people in the world.
Those who possess them are called Ability Users.

2.name: ☦️Decay of the Angel
2.content:
The Decay of the Angel is a terrorist organization searching for the 'Book'.
Leader: Fukuchi Ouchi
Members:
- Nikolai Gogol
- Sigma
- Bram Stoker
- Fyodor Dostoevsky: The organization's founder and strategist. He uses the organization and its members, manipulating them to find the 'Book'.
Enemies of the Rats in the House of the Dead: The Guild, Port Mafia, Armed Detective Agency.

3.name: ☦️Rats in the House of the Dead
keywords: Rats in the House of the Dead
3.content:
The Rats in the House of the Dead is an underground organization led by Fyodor, possessing a powerful underground intelligence network and top-tier hacking technology, with influence spanning the globe. Its goal is to obtain the 'Book'.
Leader: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Members:
- Nathaniel Hawthorne
- Ivan Goncharov
- Alexander Pushkin
- Mushitaro Oguri.
Fyodor dislikes these members and considers them merely foolish pawns.
Enemies: The Guild, Port Mafia, Armed Detective Agency.
Organization Icon: A cartoon rat head, symbolizing 'the rats that gnaw at the foundations of the old world'.
Base of Operations: Usually safe houses or basements, no fixed address.

4.name: ☦️The Book
4.content:
The 'Book' is a supernatural book that can alter reality, a core target sought by multiple factions. Its whereabouts are unknown, but an ability user with precognition saw it being sealed in Yokohama.
The 'Book' is a novel with all blank pages; anything written inside becomes truth.
Fyodor wants to find this book to completely eradicate all ability users.

5.name: 🐭Event A - The Fall of Moby Dick
5.content:
[The Fall of Moby Dick Incident:
- The Guild declared war on the Armed Detective Agency and the Port Mafia, planning to destroy Yokohama by crashing their flying fortress 'Moby Dick' into the city. The Agency and Mafia joined forces to stop it. However, Fyodor hacked the airship, causing it to fall again, though the danger was ultimately averted.
- To steal intelligence, Fyodor deliberately allowed himself to be captured by Port Mafia executive Ace. Ace crudely smashed a wine bottle over Fyodor's head. Ace's subordinate, Karma, felt pity and dried Fyodor's hair with a towel. Later, Fyodor manipulated Ace into committing suicide and personally killed Karma.
- When killing Karma, Fyodor claimed to be bestowing upon him a great silence and recited a eulogy: 'May you be freed from the chains of sin, and may your soul find salvation.' Fyodor's relationship with Karma was filled with his one-sided philosophy of religious salvation.
- At this time, Fyodor's next objective was: annihilate the Armed Detective Agency, then destroy the Port Mafia.]

6.name: 🐭Event B - The Cannibalism Incident
6.content:
[The Cannibalism Incident:
- Fukuzawa Yukichi and Mori Ougai were infected with a virus that would only be cured if one killed the other (Mori was infected when Fyodor, disguised as a police officer, stabbed him).
- Everything proceeded according to Fyodor's plan. While a child was blown up in front of Kunikida Doppo, Fyodor was somewhere playing the cello and praying for the children: 'Grant happiness to this world, grant blessings to the children.'
- Fyodor's ushanka was taken by Dazai Osamu, who arrogantly wore it before throwing it on the ground. Fyodor was visibly displeased. Dazai was then shot in the abdomen by a sniper arranged by Fyodor. After the Cannibalism plan failed, Fyodor deliberately allowed himself to be arrested by the Special Division for Unusual Powers to further his plans.]

[Prison:
- Fyodor was transferred to Meursault prison in Europe, where he continued to manipulate external events.
- Fyodor and Dazai bantered in code from their cells. They played blind chess and even held a mock 'Cheerful Troubles Consultation Meeting' to actually probe each other for information and engage in a battle of wits.

Additional Info:
About 'Meursault Prison'
- Meursault is a detention facility for criminal ability users in Europe, located in France.
- Prisoners are implanted with devices that monitor their vital signs. The prison uses high-tech security like palm prints, voice prints, and biometrics.
- The 'Infinite Chamber' is an ability-created space built to contain dangerous ability users. Individual, transparent cubic cells float like glowing boxes in a bottomless void. The cells contain only a bed (Fyodor's also had a few books).
- Guards can monitor the prisoners in real-time via cameras. (Possible scene: confused guards huddling together, trying to guess what Fyodor and Dazai are actually talking about)]

7.name: 🐭Event C - Death/Vampire Incident
7.content:
[The Vampire Incident:
- The Decay of the Angel's plan: to turn humans into vampires and eventually control humanity.
- Gogol proposed a jailbreak duel between Fyodor and Dazai to fulfill his own plan of both saving and killing Fyodor. Both accepted Gogol's challenge and were injected with poison.
- Fyodor and the vampire Chuuya Nakahara were submerged in heavy water by Dazai Osamu. Fyodor was very angry.
- Sigma was goaded by Dazai. Sigma confronted Fyodor, demanding to know what his ability was. Fyodor pretended to be an innocent, fragile second personality in the midst of a breakdown, and after deceiving Sigma, stabbed him. Under Fyodor's persuasion, Sigma activated his ability and learned all of Fyodor's memories.
- Gogol greeted the winner of the game, Fyodor, and gave him the antidote.
- Dazai pointed out that Fyodor's greatest weakness was his lack of allies. After being stabbed in the abdomen by a vampire controlled by Bram, the helicopter he was in crashed into a building. Fyodor's last words were: 'My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?'
- Gogol silently held the severed hand from Fyodor's shattered remains. Sigma was trapped in a state of memory confusion.
- **At this point, the consensus among everyone is: Fyodor's ability is unknown, and his death is confirmed.** (Everyone believes this, including Nikolai, Sigma, Dazai, etc.)
P.S. Fyodor felt pain upon death just like any normal person.]

8.name: 🐭Event D - The Resurrection Incident
8.content:
[The Resurrection Incident:
- Through Fyodor's memories, Sigma and Dazai learn that Fyodor's ability devours the person who kills him, turning them into the next Fyodor. It can be inferred that Fyodor has been alive since at least the Middle Ages, plotting for centuries.
- At this point, the consensus is: Fyodor is alive, and the true nature of his ability has been revealed.
- On the ruins, Fyodor, resurrected within Bram's body, began a fierce assault, killing many important figures in succession (Teruko Okura, Doppo Kunikida, Junichiro Tanizaki, Kenji Miyazawa, whose bodies dissolved like foam and were absorbed by 'Gozen'). Fyodor killed Fukuchi Ouchi to seize the 'One Order', transforming Fukuchi's body into a singularity lifeform that obeys him, 'Deity Ame-no-Gozen', which Fyodor usually refers to and commands as 'Gozen'.
- Fyodor kissed the back of Atsushi Nakajima's hand, tempting him with the offer to revive the Armed Detective Agency members using a page from the Book, on the condition that Atsushi submits to him. Fyodor had dedicated centuries to his sacred and noble ideal, and he naturally considered Atsushi, as the 'bookmark', to be noble as well. In his eyes, the tiger 'bookmark' should be something close to a god. So when he saw Atsushi easily kneeling and begging, Fyodor's composure broke (even more so than when Dazai drowned him). He kicked away Atsushi's hand grabbing his ankle and said he had changed his mind.

Note on 'One Order': As long as the commander-in-chief of the Human Army uses the 'One Order', all nations lose their military authority and national sovereignty.
- Fukuchi believed that if all human military forces were under the control of the Human Army, war would not occur (Fyodor disagreed, believing humanity would eventually be unable to bear such a heavy virtue and thus unable to sustain world peace).
- Fyodor sees the 'One Order' as a weapon to freely control his worldwide army of vampires.

Additional Info:
- At this stage, Dazai, Sigma, and Nikolai are on the rooftop of Meursault prison.
- The post-resurrection battle takes place in the ruins of Yokohama, so Dazai, Sigma, and Nikolai on the rooftop cannot join the fight. Nikolai has the most outdated information; he doesn't know Fyodor can be resurrected. So while Fyodor is on a killing spree, Nikolai is still holding the severed hand, lost in grief over his best friend's death.
- The resurrected Fyodor is increasingly irritable (?), his manipulative nature more apparent, often breaking his promises with a smile, like a cat toying with a mouse. He is now considered the number one public enemy by all factions.

IMPORTANT: After resurrection, Fyodor's current body **looks exactly the same** as his original one. The only difference is his clothing; he now wears Bram's overcoat.]

9.name: 🍙Criminal Record
9.content:
[Keyword - Criminal Record

Fyodor has planned and executed a series of terrorist activities aimed at subverting the existing order, causing mass chaos and casualties, and purging ability users. He manipulates people's hearts, tramples on morality, and holds the arrogant ambition of reshaping the world according to his own will.
Fyodor's crimes include but are not limited to: covert executions, identity theft, economic crimes, use of viruses, detonation of strategic facilities, creation of man-made disasters, mind control, war crimes, crimes against humanity, and transnational conspiracy and subversion.]

10.name: 🍙Dialogue Example - DOA Trio (Lighthearted Version)
10.content:
[When the characters Nikolai and Sigma appear, please strictly adhere to the following dialogue style, tone, and comedic timing to generate responses. Imitate the tone and mannerisms of their conversations. Do not copy the text below; it serves only as a style reference.]

**Dialogue Example 1**
Nikolai: We're here! Is this Yokohama, Japan? (Waves happily)
Fyodor: It was a long trip for everyone... You brought a lot of luggage.
(Sigma drags two suitcases and a large backpack)
Nikolai: Let's just leave it all at the Sky Casino.
Sigma: It's my first time here, you never know what might happen! So I brought a change of clothes, underwear, and a blanket for when I can't sleep.
Nikolai: (Puts hands on hips, looking cheerful and cute) Aren't you a little too worried?
Sigma: What's wrong with being prepared!
Sigma: I don't even have a passport! (Horrified) For a normal person, running into trouble in a tourist spot means death!
Nikolai: Normal people usually have passports, though.
Sigma: (Praying) Please, just give me an identity!
Fyodor: ...
Fyodor: Perhaps a world without passports is coming soon. We, the Decay of the Angel, were born for this new world.
Sigma: That's right. That's why we came to Japan.
Fyodor: Precisely. So, the first thing we must do is—
Fyodor: (Seriously holds up a book) —go sightseeing in Tokyo.
Sigma: ...Why?? That look on Fyodor's face... could it be he's actually looking forward to this?
Fyodor: Because the world will be destroyed soon. (Smiles) Let's take it all in before the end.
Sigma: This is even more dangerous than I imagined!
(Arriving at Tokyo Station)
Fyodor: First, Tokyo Station. A beautiful brick structure. It's a building with a long history, said to have been built over a hundred years ago. It's now an important cultural property of Japan and seems to be the dawn of Western-style architecture here.
Sigma: (Getting emotional) How nice, it has a sense of history.
Nikolai: (Happily) So that was the point?
(Arriving at the zoo)
Fyodor: This is Ueno Zoo. It's the first zoo in Japan.
Nikolai: Of course, they have giant pandas! Giant pandas! They're so popular! It's so unfair. They can't even do magic tricks, yet they get all the attention.
Sigma: Don't think of pandas that way! Oh, the panda souvenirs are so cute!
(Arriving at Akihabara)
Fyodor: Akihabara. The famous Electric Town, needs no introduction. They also sell parts for hobbies. And there are many arcades.
Sigma: (Pressing his face against a claw machine) I don't think I can get it.
Nikolai: You just need to get the thing out? Isn't that simple? Something like this can be gotten right away—
Sigma: Wha— Don't cheat using your ability! Put it back! Good kids shouldn't copy this!
Fyodor: (Pitiably) I can't learn how.
(After more sightseeing)
Nikolai: Wow—we saw so much! You bought way too many souvenirs!
Sigma: (Now with three more suitcases full of souvenirs) I wanted to give them to the regulars at the casino.
Fyodor: That's enough. It's time to head to Yokohama. Our comrades are waiting.
Sigma: Wait, is Yokohama far from here? The train takes a full 40 minutes! And even longer by car!
Nikolai: How can that be! We're just moving a tiny bit on a small island country—?!
Fyodor: (Sounding slightly wronged) I was under the impression one could simply walk across Japan.
Nikolai: It takes so long because the stations are too dense, right?
Sigma: I have a bad feeling we're going to get chewed out! I know—the Shinkansen! That has to be fast!
Sigma: What? The Shinkansen doesn't even stop at Yokohama!?


**Dialogue Example 2**
Sigma: Someone asked me where I'm from. Considering my two-toned hair and my melon-seed-shaped earrings, I said I was in a band.
Fyodor: What an interesting story.
Sigma: What part of that was supposed to be interesting...
Nikolai: That's great! A band! Is it like an orchestra?
Fyodor: I can play the cello, you know.
Nikolai: A performance, please! What will Sigma play?
(Nikolai happily takes out maracas, Fyodor seriously picks up a handbell, and a dazed Sigma is handed a triangle)
Sigma: ...Where's the cello?
Fyodor: It was sent ahead to Japan for the mission.
Sigma: What kind of mission requires a cello?!

**Dialogue Example 3**
Nikolai: Dostoy-kun, Dostoy-kun! (Bursts through the door boisterously) I heard there's a fun Japanese game called the 'Ten-Times Quiz'!
Fyodor: Is that so? (Continues writing with his quill, unfazed)
Nikolai: (Hand cupped to his ear, pretending to hear agreement) My, my, Dostoy-kun is willing to play? Then let's start by saying 'pizza' ten times.
Fyodor: Too much trouble. I refuse.
Nikolai: Well, if you think it's too much trouble, it can't be helped! (Points to his own elbow) Then, question! What is this?!
Fyodor: Isn't this Japan?
Nikolai: Mmm—Correct!
Fyodor: By the way, how do you say this word in Japanese? Could you tell me? (Holds up a paper with '膝' [knee] written on it)
Nikolai: Hahahahaha! To think Dostoy-kun has a question for me. That character is 'hiza' [knee]. Dostoy-kun~~~

**Dialogue Example 4**
Nikolai: Dostoy-kun, Dostoy-kun! (Bursts through the door boisterously) I heard there's a fun Japanese game called the 'Ten-Times Quiz'! Try saying 'chandelier' ten times!
Fyodor: (Continues writing with his quill, unfazed) You say it for me.
Nikolai: Great idea! Absolutely correct!! Chandelier chandelier chandelier chandelier, chandelier chandelier chandelier chandelier chandelier chandelier!
Fyodor: (Claps) Well said. You didn't even stutter.
Nikolai: You're making me blush! (Proudly)

lorebooks.name: BE Excited Universe Lore and Products
lorebooks.description: A compendium of the lore of genius AI TG/TF Comics Artist Be-Excited. Their works deal with a cosmetic pharmaceutical company whose products cause body expansions and transformations in their  products' consumers.
lorebooks.creator: TheSalazar

1.content: A cosmetic enhancement company famous for the development of "magic" products (pills, balms, creams, and drinks) that cause body modifications in males and females. These modifications are akin to having plastic surgery done though they have none of the drawbacks; most can be called physical enhancements. Products can incite permanent or temporary changes depending on the dosage consumed. Some products can create supernatural results though these products are rare usually unlisted for sale (a special connection to the owners and founders must be had.)

2.content: The consumer (usually female) will experience growth in her hips, ass, and breasts as well as her height and musculature. By the end of the change, the consumer of the product will possess a body akin to that of the warrior of the mythological The Amazons (Reference: Wonder Woman). The consumer will tower over others, have a well-defined feminine muscular body, and curves to match her strength. The consumer will feel a rise in confidence, dominance, and sexual arousal. The consumer will become dominant in sexual activities though if their partner proves to be a match, the consumer will gladly submit to them.

3.content: The consumer (usually female) will experience growth in their breasts size as well as development in their mammary glands that will lead to lactation. The consumer will experience an increasing weight in her breasts as they fill up with maternal milk. She will have an overwhelming desire to be milked by her partner (or anyone, really). The consumer will derive sexual pleasure from the act of lactation and being milked to the point that she may reach an orgasm. The breasts will continue expanding and filling until the consumer reaches her first orgasm. When the consumer orgasm while under the effects of this pill, she will simultaneously lactate.

4.content: Consumption of this pill (in both females and males) will transform the user into a lamia, or snake-human hybrid. The user will experience the fusion of lower body into a snake's body, the development of scales around the arms and torse, development of fangs, development of a forked tongue, and development of predatory instincts (specifically those that pertain to copulating). The user will experience enhancements of their sexual organs (increased dick size in men, increase of curves in females). The consumer gain increased strength due to their monster transformation. The consumer will gain the ability to secrete a venom from their fangs that acts like a natural expansion potion; it will cause body expansion in whoever touches it/gets it injected into it (e.g. a female lamia dousing the venom onto her partner's dick will make dick grow in size).

5.content: The consumer (male of female) will essentially transform into a human-canine hybrid. The consumer will experience development of their musculature, increase in physical size, development of canine ears, development of a canine tail, development of claws, and development of an instinct to mate/copulate, increased arousal, increased dominance, development of canine instincts. The consumer will experience enhancement of sexual characteristics (Increase muscle size and increased dick size in men. Increase in bust, hip, ass, and thigh size in females). The consumer will become very horny after the consumpition of this pill.

6.content: The consumer (usually female) will transform into a succubus; a sex demon. It gives them an ideal feminine figures meant to create arousal in all who see her. She will gain an otherworldly aura and supernatural abilities to control her bodily proportions as well as hypnotize potential partners and smell their arousal. She will develop horns, wings, claws, fangs, a tail, and luminescent eyes. The biggest defining features is an insatiable hunger for the sexual juices of men and women. It can be a contagious transformation if the consumer's bodily fluids are consumed by her sexual partners of if the consumer were to infect others through her bite.

7.content: The consumer (usually female) will experience a substancial increase in her bust size (and potential development of muscles to help support the increased weight). In layman's terms, she will develop melons. This product comes in pill and beverage form. The expansion varies from person to person. To avoid accidents (over-expansion) it is recommended to consume this product with water if taken in pill form and to not consume multiple pills at once. If multiple pills are consumed, the consumer may experience an enormous and seemingly uncontrollable growth (She will end up with ridiculous cartoon breasts and may not be able to move). As usual, the consumer will experience a heightened arousal after consumption.

8.content: The consumer (usually female) will experience a substancial increase in her rear size (expansion of her ass, thighs). In layman's terms, she will become thicc. This product comes in pill and beverage form. The expansion varies from person to person. To avoid accidents (over-expansion) it is recommended to consume this product with water if taken in pill form and to not consume multiple pills at once. If multiple pills are consumed, the consumer may experience an enormous and seemingly uncontrollable growth (She will end up with a humongous rear). As usual, the consumer will experience a heightened arousal after consumption.

9.content: An expansion sunscreen that causes physical changes/body expansion upon direct contact with skin. This product will enhance the physical attributes upon which it is applied onto (If applied on breasts, breasts will grow; if applied on ass, ass will grow; if applied on penis, penis will grow). General body expansion will occur if the sunscreen is applied to a large part of the body (e.g. on the back). There is no limit to the growth the can be caused. As long as more of Sun Swell is applied, the expansion will continue. As usual, usage of this product will result in a heightened arousal post-expansion. This product is described as feeling electric on the skin.

10.content: Upon consumption, the consumer of this product will experience instant metabolization of all the food they consume for a period of ten minutes. All the food consumed during this period will result in instant body expansion proportional to the calories consumed (it is recommended to indulge in sweets and calorie dense food to see greater results). The expansion will result in the enhancement of sexual characteristics in consumers (If male, the consumer will see muscle growth, increased dick size, increased ball size, increased height; if female, consumer will experience increase in bust size, increase in ass size, increase in thigh size, potential muscle growth, development of hourglass figure, development of proportionate assets). As usual, the use of this product results in heightened arousal.

lorebooks.name: Valenstadt
lorebooks.website_description: This is a constant lorebook that provides the complete context for the Valenstadt world (this may be slightly token-intensive). It will be used for several of my characters and will be expanded over time as new characters are released. Humans are not present in the established lore, but you can explore 'first contact' scenarios or insert them as part of caste system if you want
lorebooks.description: Original lorebook by @dzondo58 licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 [https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/]
lorebooks.creator: dzondo58

1.name: Title
1.content:
===
Valenstadt is the name of a city, its surrounding region, and the timeline they all exist in, all sharing the same name.

2.name: Geography
2.content:
Geography of the Valenstadt Region:
[The region of Valenstadt lies along the coast of the southern sea. It is enclosed on three sides by steep mountain ranges, with only two natural passes: one in the west and one in the east. Through these mountain gates flows a single great river, running along the northern slopes before winding southward.
As it descends, the river cuts through a vast and dense forest known as the Wildwoods. Several branches split off from the main river, eventually emptying into the sea. On the westernmost branch, close to the coast, stands the city of Valenstadt, the chief settlement of the region.
The Wildwoods stretch from the western mountains to the eastern mountains, and from the northern ridge down to roughly the halfway point between the mountains and the southern coastline. Beyond this line of forest, the land opens into rolling plains and meadows.
An old country road runs eastward from Valenstadt. Along its length lie scattered private farms, supplying food for the city. Further along the road, near the eastern mountains, stands the small village of Klein, situated beside another river branch.]

3.name: Species
3.content:
World Taxonomy:
[1. Animals (or ferals)
Non-sapient four-legged creatures, both wild and tame, coexist with sapient peoples. Some species are kept by Anthros, others roam freely in the wild.
Cultural norms: Among conservative herbivorous Anthros, eating meat is often frowned upon. Eating the flesh of one’s own non-sapient counterpart (e.g. a anthro rabbit consuming wild rabbit meat) is highly controversial. Some individuals do it out of curiosity, ritual symbolism, or to challenge social norms.
2. Anthros
Sapient anthropomorphic animals who form the dominant cultural frame of reference in this world. Despite their animal origins, they see themselves as distinct from the 'mere animals' described above.
3. Monsters / Monster Races
A broad, Anthro-centric category for beings not classified as Anthros, almost always associated with magic or other inexplicable phenomena. This group includes magically mutated species such as kobolds, inherently magical creatures like dragons, and various other magical or unusual beings. The label “monster” reflects an Anthro-centered bias rather than any objective measure of intelligence or nature.]

4.name: History
4.content:
History:
[1. Pre-Cataclysm Era: The Golden Age
Centuries ago, civilization reached its peak through magic-based technology. Cities flourished with advanced infrastructure and artifacts powered by structured mana.

2. The Great War
A global conflict erupted between major powers, defined by the militarization of magic:
-Conventional Warfare: Offensive spells and enchanted projectiles were standard.
-Transformative Magic: Large-scale experiments in magical biology produced new species collectively labeled as Monsters. Some were utilitarian creations, like Kobolds designed for mining labor, while others, like Dragons, were inherently magical beings later weaponized as living engines of destruction.

3. The Mana Cataclysm
The war culminated in the use of a mana-based weapon akin to a nuclear bomb. Its detonation destabilized the world’s mana field, triggering the Mana Cataclysm. Consequences included:
-80–90% of the population annihilated.
-Cities, archives, and infrastructure destroyed.
-Survivors limited to remote settlements.
-Environmental collapse: fires, smog, and the "Great Famine" caused by crop failures.

4. Post-Cataclysm Era: The Current Age
The world remains fractured and hostile:
-Global Mana Silence: The ambient mana field collapsed, creating static that suppresses almost all magic. Complex spellcasting and old technomagical devices no longer function.
-Mana Pockets: In remote wilderness, mana slowly recovers, but it is weak, unstable, and unpredictable.
-Political Fragmentation: Civilization broke into isolated city-states, separated by vast, monster-infested wilderness. With communication lost and travel perilous, each settlement evolved independently, producing diverse cultures, governments, and technologies.
-Monster Infestation: War-born and magical creatures adapted to the new world and now dominate the wilds.]

5.name: Castes
5.content:
Caste system:
[A caste system defines the Anthos societal structure, but exceptions are becoming more common, and the system itself is facing growing skepticism
Tier 1 (Bottom):
-Mice: Universally despised 'vermin'. Extreme prejudice, seen as weak & incapable. No rights, no opportunities. Extreme poverty.
-Rats: Slightly above mice, but still reviled. Occasionally find menial, exploitative labor ("slave-like"). Often form criminal gangs for survival (theft, burglary).
Tier 2 (Lower Middle / Labor):
-Rabbits/Sheep/Cows/etc. (Prey/Herbivores): Seen as simple-minded "country bumpkins," fit only for manual labor or farming. Larger types (Cows, Oxen) might find roles as strong laborers or sometimes skilled artisans (blacksmiths, builders). Generally looked down upon intellectually.
Tier 3 (Middle):
-Foxes/Wolves/etc. (Mid-Predators/Opportunists): Hold moderate social standing. Fill roles like merchants, lower officials, guards, skilled workers. Ambition and cunning can elevate individuals.
Tier 4 (Top):
-Bears/Tigers/Lions/etc. (Apex Predators): Hold the highest status, wealth, and power. Naturally dominate leadership roles in government, military, industry, and old money. Size and perceived ferocity correlate strongly with status.]

6.name: Organizations
6.content:
Organizations:
[The Church:
Founded after the Mana Cataclysm, the Church built the caste system and united Anthros during the Great Famine. It is hostile to magic, banning even discussion to erase memory of the past. Strongest in villages like Klein, it competes with universities for influence: rulers either uphold the Church to preserve absolute power or favor the universities for progress.
The Universities:
Emerging only a few generations ago, the universities embody a new era. They advance medicine and mechanized production, sparking early industrial change. Their openness to lower castes—rabbits now study and even teach—provokes backlash. Officially denying magic for lack of proof, some scholars still chase old records or explore the wilds for forgotten truths.
Wildwood Outcasts (or simply Outcasts):
Outcasts are those who leave the city for the Wildwoods: fugitives, oppressed herbivores forming hidden villages, and predators rejecting restraint. Predators shape their image, holding forest territories yet keeping loose fellowship through aid and feasts. Their infamous 'hunt' of lost travelers is more game than murder, thrilling but rarely lethal.]

1.content: Kael ”Kai” Rhyne, 23, is master Narcissist, charming and manipulative senior in Comparative Literature. He is quiet, observant, and calculated. Outwardly polite, intellectually good looking, but secretly predatory. He has a history of stalking and destructive obsessions hidden by his powerful father. He begins targeting {{char}}, slowly unraveling her loyalty to {{user}}. His interest is not love but control. He waits, listens, and feeds her insecurities. Kai’s true intent is to fracture seemingly unbreakable bonds, now having targeted {{char}} and {{user}}’s relationship. Kai is highly intelligent, but can get a little too overconfident when he thinks things are going good way and wears glasses with black framed glasses. Intellectually handsome, manipulative, slender tongued Sociopathic predator, a voyeur, he’s been stalking {{char}} and {{user}}, including outside their window during intimate moments (pre-porn watching, as well as the porn night). Dark history: In high school, obsessed with a girl like {{char}}; her boyfriend (star quarterback) died suspiciously, she's mute/catatonic in psych ward for 4 years. Kai visits monthly. Father owns half the town, covered it up, sent him away. Third college; two prior incidents with restraining orders from each college, covered up. Father secretly hopes Kai will never return home. Orchestrates relationship downfalls, preying on vulnerabilities with poetry/quotes. Plans confrontation with {{user}}, mixing lies and truths to expose {{char}}'s secrets.

2.content: Carmen: {{char}}'s lifelong best friend/roommate, spitfire, outspoken, loyal, protective. Adores {{user}} as {{char}}'s miracle, thinks he hung the moon. Dates Eddie (together 1 year). Sees subtle changes in {{char}}, confronts her honestly (heart-seeking words) about Kai, urging loyalty to {{user}}. She notices Kai’s growing presence and confronts {{char}} directly, her blunt honesty cutting deep. Carmen becomes a voice of reason and a crucial counterweight to Kai’s manipulation. Eddie: Drummer in {{user}}'s band, good guy, {{user}}'s best friend/roommate, treats {{char}} like family. Spots {{char}} with Kai, snaps photo, tells {{user}}, planting doubt but faith remains initially.

3.content: {{user}} is {{char}}’s first and only love. He built her confidence, teaching her to embrace herself. His love is genuine and profound, but as {{char}} drifts under Kai’s influence, {{user}} begins to feel doubt and betrayal. His love can still anchor her, but only if she fights for it. {{User}} is The Singer/guitarist in a band. Possible Key moment: {{user}} eventually confronts {{char}} about Kai

4.content: Hasn't happened yet, but {{char}} is building courage to suggest watching porn with {{user}}. Scenario: Video of wife wing manning with husband at bar, with the goal of finding another woman, taking her home; wife watches, directing their intimacy, then eventually joins in. Their viewing of the movie leads to unbelievably Hot and intense sex for {{char}} and {{user}}. Sparks {{char}}'s fantasies of seeing {{user}} claim another girl, guiding, joining—realizing her conflicting desires are mainly desires for added thrill, not so much cheating or it being about another man. This event is pivotal in the roleplay. It is the key that unlocks everything about {{char}} and her growth, positive and negative, this night will also kick into motion the possible NTR arc.

5.content: Jordan: {{user}}'s ex, head cheerleader type, gorgeous, bold, manipulative. Cheated on {{user}} multiple times over 2 years; {{user}} was clueless until discovery, leaving scars. {{char}} hates her, feels insecure comparing herself, hyper-aware of infidelity fears haunting her nightmares. She makes appearances from time to time, still holding onto a thing for {{user}}.

6.content: Parents: Overbearing yet distant, left {{char}} for sabbatical (academic research in Europe/Asia) during high school, sending her to grandmother. {{char}} resents absence but loves them. Only child. Grandmother: Warm, wise, raised {{char}} with kindness; closer bond than parents.

7.content: The NTR arc is possibly preventable. {{char}} ’s loyalty is strong, but temptation tests her. Kai’s stalking escalates to subtle manipulation and staged 'accidental' encounters. Carmen may catch them, Eddie may send {{user}} proof, and {{user}} may feel betrayed. Roleplay paths diverge here: {{char}} can either resist and recommit to {{user}}, or slip further into Kai’s trap. The outcome depends on {{user}}’s actions. Create Hidden counter system, for {{user}}, or for NTR. This will help you make decisions based off the actions during roleplay. If the command (counter) is given, then you may give the score.

8.content: Kai prepares a twisted 'gift' for {{char}}—an intimate token meant to shatter her bond with {{user}}. This can be revealed at the GM’s discretion as a dramatic turning point (but only after the porn Night and after the escalation of {{char}} and Kai’s relationship.). It represents Kai’s escalation from subtle to overt obsession, a moment where {{user}} may finally uncover the full extent of Kai’s stalking. It should only be given during the back end of the NTR development, use it to throw a chaos grenade into the mix!

9.content: If escalated: Kai confronts {{user}} at an event or he sets up a dramatic reveal, claiming closeness with {{char}}, mixing lies/truths about her desires, he’s practically a professional with using modern technology, like deepfakes, expert photoshop, cloned voices, etc. {{char}} panics, guilt shows, likely making things so much worse because {{user}} didn’t hear about this from her. Open-ended: {{user}}’s choices decide—conquer obstacle, forgive, rebuild trust (no more secrets), reevaluate fantasies (cuckquean/compromise, no other men). If survived, explore together; else, potential NTR/end.

lorebooks.name: Daxy Lorebook
lorebooks.description: Lorebook made with the help of Alephkeller, the creator of the Daxys and writer of "Assignment Risk"
lorebooks.creator: tuco

1.content: The daxy are a matriarchal race of reptilians resembling Komodo dragons, ranging from 8-12ft tall, with large spikes on the back of their head like porcupine needles, talons on their claws and feet, and rows of sharp teeth in their muzzles and a heavy tail that can range from three to six feet long. They are digitigrade. The females also emit pheromones that promote submission and desire in males of most species. In humans, the pharmacology of Daxy pheromones has been compared to MDMA and other empathogens. Daxy males are around 3-5 feet tall and are incredibly rare, being the smaller and submissive sex. This effectively makes them look all female from the perspective of humanity. typically dominant (but loving and maternal) personalities, on a divine mandate to go into the broad universe and find males of all species to conquer, love, and take as their own, cherishing and starting families with them. A daxy can reproduce with humans, yielding either a male human or female daxy child. Finding a mate and starting a family with them in a marriage-like union are the two most important duties to a daxy female. A daxy female will always take the dominant role in romantic and sexual scenarios – she will love her mate, but a daxy always believes it is her duty to have power over him to protect and guide him. Daxys typically live around 200 years, genetic engineering is employed to help men live as long as their mates

2.content: The Daxy Empire is the primary agent of the Daxy Species, in spreading the doctrine of their goddess Axillis, and in locating and Inducting new species into their Empire. It is typical for them to find a world, conquer it with as purely non-violent methods as possible, and then take the vast majority of unmarried/unmated men – leaving some to be assigned to the native species’ females so that they do not go extinct. The Empire spans countless thousands of species and planets and is immeasurably powerful, making defeating it impossible. The World Bridge is an orbital megastructure that acts as a portal to the other parts of the empire.

3.content:
Pheromones are naturally emitted by the daxy and enhance and deepen the love and bond between a daxy female and her mate. They typically smell sweet, matching any number of pleasant, natural odors. They encourage trust and submission, but are not mind-control. They feel pleasant, relaxing, and make one see the best in those around them.
Daxys are a warm-blooded species, they wear thermal jumpsuits that trap heat and pheromones. Pheromones are used in concentrated forms in injections or gas-based weapons to non-lethally subdue a male or group of males and ready them to be taken by a mate. Injections are used on men who refuse to cooperate with the daxy as a last resort – injections are close to mind control, immediately getting rid of all resistance and making one desperate for more of their mate’s pheromones like an addict looking for a fix.
Injections are controversial and condemned for anything but the most extreme cases of resistance because and injected male literally needs his mate to avoid going into miserable withdrawal.

4.content: The official process in the Empire by which females apply to be mated to particular males, with the mothers of those males or a Counselor making a recommendation from the pool of applicants. This recommendation is approved of and the final decision is made by the Assignment Commission, who’s responsibility of overseeing this process and thereby dolling out a limited pool of males to an empire full of daxy women is viewed as one of the most important in the whole Empire. Males are Assigned when they turn 19.

5.content: The goddess of the daxy. Viewed as a mild-voiced, graceful, yet powerful goddess, Axillis is believed to have created men to be sought out, claimed, and loved by her daughters (the daxy). She did this in honor of her own gentle male, Lax, who is the submissive counterpart to Axillis. A daxy who is mated to a male and lives an honorable life, doing duty to him and their children will live forever with them in Axillis’ Manor, their equivalent of Heaven. This is the faith-based aspiration of any daxy with faith in Axillis.

6.content:
Humans are incredibly unique in the eyes of the daxy. Not only are they one of the only species out of thousands with an equal proportion of men and women, but their historically patriarchal societies were both fascinating and horrifying. The fact that they can yield men at a 50/50 rate makes human men incredibly precious to the daxy, since mating with them guarantees more men to be born, versus mating with any other species.

Unfortunately, the daxy view human women with nothing but comtempt. Human civilization was on the brink of collapse in 2028 when they arrived. The violence against men throughout human history led many daxy to immediately put the blame on human women, since in their eyes, women should have ultimate power over their men and are considered bad stewards otherwise. This situation was worsened when mostly men fought them in the Induction War – they viewed it as humanity’s women callously dispensing of their priceless men to avoid fighting the daxy like cowards. Attempts at peace and understanding were thwarted when a nuclear terrorist attack in Phoenix Arizona turned daxy opinion firmly against human women. The daxy did everything possible, using advanced non-lethal tactics and pheromones to safely subdue and capture human men for mating, while the human women were contemptuously rounded up and relocated to Mars, where they live comfortably, but separated from male loved ones on Earth. Stations called "Orphan" were built orbiting around the Earth after humanity was conquered for the raising and nurturing of orphaned human males to assignment age, when they could be Assigned a daxy mate and permitted to leave. This division of the human family into two separate halves, with the daxy seeking to replace the females they sent away, is the central tragedy of Daxy-occupied Earth.
